My reviews have gone to shit lately... my bad.  Verdict?  I liked the bar, but not all the people in there besides those who worked there.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I've been to Bloodhound a couple of times in the last week or so and I have to say I'm a fan. I still haven't worked up the nerve to try the Big Buck Hunter, but that day will come. I've had the Recoil twice now. With it's mix of Bulleit Bourbon, St. Germain, ginger beer and lime, it has everything a girl needs to happily imbibe. For something else along those lines that will put a bit of hair on your chest (or add some pep to your step), go for the New Fashioned. It replaces the traditional sugar cube/simple syrup in an Old Fashioned with maple syrup. Somehow, this simple switch really elevates the flavor from the orange peel. If bourbon just isn't your thing, the Turf Cocktail has enough gin to really get your buzz on. The tiny sip I had of my friend's drink was plenty for me. The bartenders are really efficient and friendly and the bouncer complimented my dress. What's not to love?
author: Nicole M.

description:
PLEASE BRING BACK THE MARIN BREWING COMPANY BEER, ESPECIALLY THE MOUNT TAM!

Sorry, that was my favorite beer there and I miss it! That's the only reason this isn't five stars, because Bloodhound is one of the best bars in my backyard. Any place can have a bar, but what separates great bars from the rest are the people they attract, and damn if Bloodhound doesn't attract some of the best in the city. 

I'm new in town, so that means a lot of bar-crawling alone and I've been offered cupcakes, been swapping travel stories - even had someone I'd never met stop me as I left to give me her phone number. The bartenders are chatty and know all the regulars, and they can mix up a great cocktail (their Sazerac is my favorite) when your favorite beer disappears from the taps. This is a great first or last stop on your night out, to shoot some pool, chat up some new people, and Da Beef is just down the street for some great Chicago dogs late into the night.
author: Kevin B.

description:
An excellent establishment in a micro neighborhood that needs a great bar. Top notch brew selection, tasty cocktail list and fun decor. Weeknight or weekend, this place is consistently busy.

The Greyhound and Bloodhound drinks are good but will run you a hefty nine bucks. And speaking of bucks, Bloodhound has an interesting decor: Mood lighting, weathered wood paneling, painted crow silhouettes on the ceiling and plenty of antlers strewn about the walls.

There is also a interesting food scene here. On Thursdays, a few guys set up shop out front with a kiln and cook overpriced mini pizzas. There is also a girl dressed as Alice who occasionally walks around the bar and sells cookies (note: family friendly cookies). I've also heard of pig roasts and cookouts in the adjacent alley.

If you're in the area and looking for a solid bar that isn't a snooty beer store, clubby club or quirky laundromat, then this is your place.
author: Nick K.

description:
This place has a great vibe.  I was there early on a Saturday night, and there were maybe 10-12 people in the entire place.  It seemed pretty roomy, and the entire place had this cozy rustic look.
Great beers on tap.  The bartenders were really friendly.  And it was a nice place to catch up with a good friend I hadn't seen in a while.  

I'd definitely come back, just for the cool vibe.
author: Marc E.

description:
I've only been here on weekdays, but I enjoyed it quite a bit. Think whiskey cocktails and beer, not chardonnay and vodka sodas, although I'm sure plenty of people order those things too. The bartenders are attentive and polite. Seems like the kind of place you could become a regular if you were so inclined. 

The crowd was very mixed while I was there. A few second date types, gussied up before dinner. Some past happy hour businessmen. A couple of queers and hipsters. And even some bar-crawling monied Persians blinged out and celebrating a birthday. Everything and everyone goes.

If this place serves food, I wasn't aware of it. I sat at both the bar and in one of the lounge-y corners. I preferred the bar, where you can chat with the bartenders, meet more savvy drinkers, and avoid larger groups of people in which it seems like a dry hump session might occur at any moment. 

Would do again.
author: Emily B.

description:
Great drinks with a big open space to chat and drink. I really like this place! All of the beers are served up in mason jars and they have a good selection of them on tap! But, before you go the beer route, may I tempt you with their cocktails? Delicious! Not too sweet, not too fancy, just good. I tried their namesake - the Bloodhound, but I didn't hear a bad thing all night about any of them.

Check it out!
author: Emily S.

description: Great place to hang and have drinks in SOMA.  They have a nice selection of draft and bottled brewskis.  They even had a beer with a shot special and the bartender was very attentive.
author: Michael L.

description: Really digging the ambiance and vibe in this place. Lights are dim, nice space to walk in in the middle of the bar, booths and tables on edges, and pool table towards the back. The bathrooms are little funky, and it gets pretty packed in here because of the club next door, but drinks/cocktails are made very well. Little pricey, but it's the SOMA, and you still get served pretty quickly, so no complaints really. Be prepared to do some body surfing on your way to the bartender.
author: Danny C.

description:
I left my tab open at the bar with my credit card last night. I came in today and picked it up. Soon after I get a call from fraud protection. 
TURNS OUT SOMEONE THAT WORKS THERE TRIED TO CHARGE $200 AT A GROCERY STORE. I called to talk to someone about it but the phone just rings with no answer. I really hope the owner or a manager reads these reviews and handles this situation.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Strong, delicious cocktails (we tried the Vesper and the Bloodhound), and my minature schnauzer is allowed to hang with me inside, on the couch, while I enjoy the wonderful surroundings. 

Crowd was just the right size on the Thursday night around 11. Not too packed, lively, and everyone full of smiles and good company. :)
author: Taj A.

description: The lady here is always so sweet and nice.  I always have a blast when she is working. On the other hand one of the male bartenders seems to take up issue with certain people and skip right past them serving others first
author: Brad B.

description:
In the 5 min it took me to get 2 beers I've been touched by a guy, at whom I yelled, and hit on by another guy right away, while the batsmen was watching and did nothing.
If I can't feel safe at a place, there's no point even trying the drinks.
author: Natalie P.

description:
It's a hunting lodge in here. There's birds on the ceiling, there's antlers everywhere. The walls are wood paneled. I forgot to wear plaid, I hope they forgive me. 

The Ward 8 cocktail was delightful: bulleit rye, orange and lemon, and housemade grenadine. It was also ridiculously strong, not something I should have ended my night with. But I did anyway and I didn't feel bad about it. 

A fantastically chill vibe even though the place was fairly crowded at 9:30 on a Thursday. Bloodhound is like your cool friend who never seems like they're trying too hard, and you're just looking to blend in.
author: Emily G.

description:
Come for an Old Fashioned, share a table with strangers, stare at the ceiling, and Stone IPA on draft.

Just fight the urge to play Big Buck, it WILL take your money and only 1 player works.
author: Randy N.

description:
I finally was able to hit up Bloodhound after wanting to try it out for a while but not really on the bar scene any more.  What a great place and I'll definitely come back.  The decor is very woodsy, cabin like but not in a cheesy way.  They have a small pool table and a rifle shooting arcade game which was a lot of fun...probably because I won :)

The bartenders weren't super attentive but the beer selection more than made up for that.  I tried three different beers that I had never had before and all of them were really good.

Kudos to Bloodhound and I'll see you soon.
author: Blake B.

description:
I'm a sucker for a good theme. Bloodhound, you're doing it right. 

Drinks in mason jars are adorably rustic, but also tasty. Nice beer selection and the ginger cocktail is delightful. 

Antlers all around and Big Buck Hunter are the perfect amount of kitsch. Bartenders are really friendly and the clientele is pretty polite. You likely won't have your toes stomped on, your ears assaulted by drunks, or your night ruined by overcrowding rowdiness.

Bottom line: Great location and just a great little bar. I'll definitely be back.
author: Kellie T.

description:
Edward K. and I came here on a Saturday night. It's a chill spot. The beer that has a long ass name and starts with an F is good. I got the Kid-Sized 8oz beer and it was the perfect amount. Pretty decent prices. Definitely come here if you are looking for a place to catch up with friends and don't want a stuffy atmosphere. 

Also, too bad the food trucks were not out when I was there. I would of totally eaten some food truck goodness. Oh well, next time!
author: Angela D.

description:
Decor takes me home,
and Old Speckled Hen on draught,
I will have one more.
author: Brian J.

description: Great cocktails on the citrus/bitter side with a specialty in bourbons and whiskeys. Cool atmosphere with a modern hunters cabin vibe with a musket above the bar. They did get a security guy I'm guessing because of rising popularity however he is pretty rude and uninviting. Still worth the rad drinks. Keep em' coming.
author: Patrick O.

description: GET THE RECOIL (Bulleit, ginger beer, elderflower, lime). So tasty. I like this spot, but minus stars for the delirious bartender that thought we underpaid him. 2 drinks for $18, so we gave him a 10 dollar bill, 5 dollar bill, and five 1 dollar bills, and for some reason he thought we gave him two 5 dollar bills and four 1 dollar bills. When we explained it to him, he told us to 'get out of here'... ridiculous. Huge turn off that made me want to write this review.
author: Christine C.

description: Great service, amazing and I mean AMAZING, interesting and creative cocktails. Also just a generally cool vibe, with rustic decor. TRUST YOR BARTENDER, or might I say, mixologist... don't laugh, the shoe fits.
author: Heather B.

description:
I think it's safe to say that I was a little light on the nuances of Big Buck Hunter before I stepped into Bloodhound last night: consider that a situation resolved thanks to compadres from Portland and Brooklyn who proceeded to blast away at everything on that screen like so many drive-bys. There's quite a bit of shooting going on in what appears to be Montana. Just sayin'. 

Bloodhound is by all accounts a cozy by way of hip spot to nab a cocktail or brew, and as a professed beer nut I was only too happy to explore what they're pouring these days. In the end I settled for a North Coast Pranqster and a Sierra Nevada Holiday IPA. Tasty. Waitstaff was quick with a pour -- and if I were around more often, great place to catch a game and a cold one, natch.
author: Kevin N.

description: I was supposed to met a friend there, during HH which is 3-7 and drinks $1 off. The place has an interesting decor to say the least but it is so so laud. I ordered hefeweizen which was served in a mason jar :) and the guy took my credit card but when my friend got there we could not really talk because it was so  laud so decided to go bar next door and I wanted to close my tap and he asked for cash, I understand it was only $5 but still, it bothered me a bit.
author: Magda G.

description:
This place just got upgraded--for two reasons.

Chairman Bao's truck comes by every Wednesday night..nothing like delicious Bao to accompany your libations (more drinking and less hangovers). Also, Anthony the bartender is AWESOME!
author: Mimi T.

description:
I have to admit, this is a really neat bar. It has the hunter vibe and birds painted on the ceiling...and they served my drink, The Recoil, in a mason jar! There's a hunting video game inside and a pool table as well. I came on a Friday night with a friend from out of town...oh man, it was packed, as we had expected. We had to squeeze our way through the crowd to get inside and to the bar. The drink was really strong (to me...I'm a lightweight though). I guess it was worth the price...I had to have my friend help me finish it so I could be sober enough to help my other drunk friend later that night. 

Definitely a great scene to have some fun and meet people on a night out with friends. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves! No one was rude to me as I was trying to squeeze my way through the crowd. People also hung up their coats along the wall...I guess people are pretty trusting here with their belongings.

If you find the scene too crazy for you, you can also hop next door to Raven Bar. The scene there is more calm...Edgar Allen Poe theme.
author: Katherine S.

description: This is my place in the 'hood! It has a comfy living room feel, unusual cocktails and is dog friendly.  Yep - you read that right - dog friendly.
author: Kim W.

description:
Went here with friends for the first time last night. 

No cover on a Friday night which is nice. It was dark and loud, the music was all over the place. I couldn't quite put my finger on a theme for the bar. 

Hipsters galore, a specialty drink menu, an almost-old-west theme, but with a mix of salsa, hip hop and disco music playing... 

I would def go back again, I had a great time.
author: Kate D.

description: I used to come here ones a week. Today they didn't allowed me in their bar because I'm Russian and don't have American ID. What kind of ID  do they except from person from an other country? Still a mystery for me. Moreover, most of the time bartenders don't pay any attention to the customers, so u have to wait around 10-20 min for one drink. The only think I like about this bar is Ricoil, it's good, but it's pretty all.
author: Ekaterina O.

description: Went there today for happy hour  - waited at the bar for 20 min - both bartenders never paid attention and kept skipping me, what a waste of time.
author: Dave K.

description:
You know, its really the experience that determines how well you like the place from the first impression. It was my first time we decided to go to a bar out in SOMA. When I heard bloodhound, I imagined a grungy dark and divey bar. I was oh so wrong. 
 
The place is barely lit, the atmosphere was buzzing with people who looked like hipsters. Awesome! I looked up at the bird painted ceiling. Pretty cool! 

Drinks were okay, I would come more so for the atmosphere.
author: Becky Q.

description:
I came to Bloodhound to kick off my new diet.

http://nyti.ms/cVcGcV

"Metabolic studies show that after men drink alcohol, they experience little if any metabolic change."  (Sorry fellas!)  "But alcohol appears to slightly speed up a woman's metabolism."  (Goodbye gym!  Hellooo cocktails!)

I almost ordered the "Peach Blossom" but I just couldn't order a drink that sounds like / makes me look like a Geisha Girl.  So I got the "Recoil" which was an interesting mix of Buffalo Trace Bourbon, Ginger Beer, St. Germain Elderflower Liqueur, and Lime.  This liquid lipo cost $9.  My friend ordered a beer and admired the wide array of alcohol bottles in front of us.

I also burned some calories admiring the creatively painted ceiling, counting the number of animal skulls on the wall and mason jars on the bar, scanning the large room to unsuccessfully attempt to categorize the odd crowd, and dispensing interwebs generated Dr. Phil-esque dating advice.  ("You don't need Zsa Zsa Gabor to make out with somebody's platypus.") 

I'm feelin' the burn!
author: Amy C.

description:
Great beers and even better spirits. If you're in SOMA, this is your living room. A great bar, with a very cool decor (love the painted bird shadows) and some bartenders that are very skilled. The young lady particularly knows her whiskey. Don't challenge her. This is also a fantastic place for some nice rums and a decent bit of tequila.

I'd give it a 5 for as much as I love the place (particularly being able to play Big Buck), but it gets way too packed and they could keep it from getting so full a little better.
author: Darin A.

description:
There is a $20 minimum on credit/debit cards. I told the bartender that VISA doesn't allow that, it's clearly stated in their terms and conditions. His answer was "I don't give a shit".
Not coming back after being treated like that.
author: Ignacio S.

description:
I actually like this place more than the rating indicates.  Drinks are good (namely the whiskey-based cocktails) and the decor is pretty cool.

I guess the lack of stars might be an impact of its popularity since the two times I've been there I've found it to be insanely crowded, ridiculously hot and it takes a long time to get drinks.  The tough life of a popular bar I guess.
author: Ken L.

description:
Bloodhound is my SOMA equivalent to Rye. When I'm with the BF at his place, Bloodhound. When we're at my place, Rye. Both make a killer Old Fashion (or in Bloodhound's case, 'New Fashion') and they both have that edgy/rugged/old-timey feel that I adore. 

Look out, Regulars, you're going to have to fight me for a barstool.
author: Julia N.

description:
This place used to be a cool Irish dive bar, then it became Bloodhound and VERY hipstery.  Animal heads on the walls kind of trendy hipsterness.  

It was difficult to get a drink at the bar, as throngs of hipsters wearing ironic plaid shirts were lined up to get their artisinal cocktails.  Some of the guys looked like they were trying to impersonate Paul Bunyan with their thick, ironic beards and plaid mountain man shirts.  But the skinny jeans and ten dollar cocktails gave them away. ;-)
author: Dave N.

description: This place was alright.  It was pretty late when we got there so there weren't that many people around, which was fine by me.  There was some random guy that wouldn't stop talking to me though, and that was annoying.  What was worse, he was talking about high school football -- I think it was talking about how HE played, which made the whole conversation that much worse.  My friend managed to hop in and give me a conversation out before I punched the guy in desperation though, so that was good.  (he wasn't hitting on me or anything, just being punch-me-in-the-face annoying is all).
author: Michael L.

description:
I reckon this here might be a nice saloon to grab yerself a whiskey when the mood strikes. Fix what ails ye.

That was certainly a pitiful attempt at cowboy lingo, but take a gander at the main pics of Bloodhound and you'll catch my drift. Lean against the wood slat walls and ponder the antler chandelier, tip back a booze filled mason jar or two, catch up with old pals or new. It's a bar I'd almost call "upscale" that still has the nonchalance of a saloon.

The crowd can be a touch pretentious, something I've notice about select bars in SOMA. Annoying customers be damned, the bartenders are thorough and will chat you up about their cocktail list to make sure you're comfortable with your drink selection.

Bonus points for the amazing ceiling. Simple yet repeatedly eye catching. Word to the wise, do NOT ogle the birds if you're traveling through 'tipsy' and on to 'drunk'. Don't even glance upward if nearing 'wasted'. I witnessed a girl, most definitely hammered, continuously look up at the ceiling. She was mumbling about the birds, how she loved birds, loved *these* birds, wished she had birds... You know, annoying alcohol induced repetition. She eventually stared at the birds so intently, drunk as shit, that she predictably toppled backwards, right into two people, drinks in hand. Some folks just can't handle the birds it seems. They're cool, but check them out before getting tanked ok?
author: Justin N.

description: This is my housemates + my go-to bar as it's just a block and a half away from our apartment.  They have a pool table and I learnt to play Big Buck Hunter here, a small dece cocktail menu and delicious Old Speckled Hen in mason jars.  You'll often run into Zynga and Airbnb engineers here (may be a good or a bad thing).  In any case, I've had some awesome fun nights at Bloodhound!
author: Letitia L.

description:
Chill & Hip Bar in SOMA...
Popped into this spot in a wednesday  for happy hour... Didn't wait long for a drink & even found a seat right away. And I love LOVE LOVE... the 80s music playing! Decent size crowd for a Wednesday, but still some lounge seating available.
author: Teena Marie T.

description: Any place that serves cocktails as good as this place AND allows dogs in the bar is ok by me. Really awesome not pretensions vibe even though it's right across from the courthouse and you get a lot of drunk lawyers talking shit
author: James T.

description:
I always find myself coming here for any reason.
I've gone once a week for the past 3 weeks now. I always get a new fashion and I am never disappointed.

It not too loud in there so it's an awesome place to go on a date there. Light music in the back ground. TVs and a pool table if you aren't interested in talking.

DOG FRIENDLY!

Most likely I'll be there next weekend. Oh wait i'll be out of town 
:(
author: Anne-Mary P.

description: Super chill but busy bar with a diverse group of patrons. They made my friend a mojito, how many bars are willing to do that?!
author: Vivian H.

description: They have Enjoy By, which was awesome, but apparently, if you want a beer and you're here with your husband, they won't let him close his eyes for a few minutes even though it's midnight and he's been up working since 5 am. They call it "passed out" even if he isn't drunk. They literally said "You know how you can't kill people? You can't lay down at a bar." I. Kid. You. Not. Because the two are so similar.
author: Rory M.

description:
Awesome spot for HAPPY HOUR! Packed when I went a few fridays ago. If you wanna grab a booth, make sure to arrive early....before 5 PM. great bar...lots of selection. 

My recommendation: arrive early!
author: Heather H.

description:
I can't exactly put my finger on why Bloodhound is such a great bar. It maintains a bit of a hipster vibe, but yet is totally friendly and unpretentious at the same time. The decor is very frontier - woodsy, open, and super laid back . . . and it's still one of the coolest places on this side of the SOMA. The drinks are not only served in mason jars, but they're stiff and delicious (try "The Recoil," if it's available). It's a chill, local spot to hang out on a sunny Sunday afternoon, but at the same time transforms effortlessly into a Friday night happening destination.

So, yeah. While I can't succinctly conjure up exactly what it is, I can definitely say that it's worth five stars.
author: Betty W.

description: Great local bar that hasn't faded over time like so many great bars due.  I love the liquor selection and the bartenders.  This place has a good mix of patrons and is a great place for meeting people.
author: Darin E.

description: This place has all the makings of a great bar. Cool atmosphere-check. Excellent tunes on the jukebox-check (heard both Little Dragon and The Ramones within the span of 15 minutes-love it!)..Crowded but still able to carve out a small space for ourselves-yep. Oh wait there's one minor detail- the drinks were awful!!! We tried four different cocktails off their menu, as well as a Hemingway Daiquiri-all terrible..If you enjoy beer and nothing else this may be the place for you. Otherwise you're just wasting your cash.
author: Ritu K.

description:
In a world where you wish to kick back and sip some good Speckled Hen out of a mason jar, Bloodhound is the place to be. Like many have said, just plan to be chill. This place will entertain you in more ways than one. Let me count them for you:

1) This place draws an interesting crowd filled with late twenty-somethings. The dudes in their J. Crew collared shirts and Lucky jeans. Girls I couldn't quite put a finger on them...most looked frumpy. But interestingly enough we found two dudes matching in lumberjack flannel shirts playing Big Buck Hunter and a group that we had a hard time deciding whether they came from an 80's party or wore white blazers over neon blue v-necks on their spare time.

2) Big Buck Hunter arcade game + pool table. Enough said.

3) Look up. Really. The birds painted on the ceiling will freak you out because they look so real. 

The only real peeve was the music was forgettable. Other than that, a well established joint.
author: Grace L.

description:
As a lifelong "I Love Lucy" fan, I *heart* that they have a drink named 
after Ricky Ricardo.  It's good, too!  (I guess it would have to be if it was named after Ricky, right?)  Herradura silver tequila, lime, and....well, some other stuff that I can't remember.  Their specialty drinks are mighty tasty, but they also have a good inventory of beers on tap. 

I haven't been here on a weekend, but it's definitely a cool place to hang during the week.  It's spacious with lots of seating, so it works well if you have a large group.  Best of all, they serve no pesky food to get in the way of your buzz.  You can soak up the alcohol later at Extreme Pizza, which is only a block away.  Alternatively, The Cat Club is in the same block, so you can go dance it off if your timing is right!

I guess the only drawback for me is that their Happy Hour could be a little bit happier ($1 off a $9 cocktail isn't really much of a discount).

P.S.  Check out the cool black birds stenciled on the ceiling!
author: Kimberly B.

description: There was one bartender there that was a complete a**hole for no reason at all. I was waiting at the bar VERY patiently for about 20 minutes. He had served so many people that came up after me and then FINALLY he asked me what I wanted and I ordered a vodka and soda. Then he yelled "is that it!? That's all you want to order after you looked like you were waiting SO impatiently!?!? Are you sure you're not going to order something else after I give you this drink?!" I was Sooooo appalled and so shocked at how rude he was. I've never experienced this kind of service before from a bartender especially being a girl and seriously waiting 20 minutes for a drink.  Even though I liked everything else about this place I don't think I'll ever come back because of that one bartender (the darker haired one. The other one was nice). EXTREMELY rude service especially for someone who works off tips.
author: J S.

description: So lets bring the backyard inside, shall we?  My friend and I stopped by this joint last night for a beer.  I swear it was like being in a backyard except we were inside.  The ceilings were painted of with black birds flying.  Cool joint, to hang out.  It was crowded, then again it was still happy hour.  Check it out if you are in the neiborhood.
author: Liz D.

description: A bar in the middle of nowhere-ish (ok, a decent number of bars/restaurants on this block, but on a Monday night this was the only one that was alive & happening, yet not overly packed). Dark wood contours. Drinks served out of mason jars (that always gets me). A laid back yet lively crowd. Awesome ceilings - I won't try to describe it - just go there and check it out. You won't regret it.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Having been relegated to the South Bay email list of ELite events, I've not been to an SF one in a long time. I suppose if I had the time and will I'd be scouring the calendar more often but work keeps getting in the way. When I found out one of the old school Yelpers was leaving the area, I made it to Bloodhound for the rendezvous. On a Sat night this place is packed to the gills. I had to wait outside for a few minutes, though the door man was cool. Going inside, the rustic bar with a number of hard working bartenders were scurrying around while, tons of young drinkers clamored to get around. 

Running into various Yelpers I'd not seen in years, it was like an event back in the old days. I sidled up to the bar and deciding that I didn't want to get back into the crush of things again, I double fisted with a Recoil and Ward 8. Both Bourbon based drinks, they hit the spot as I made my way back to the group. 

I can't count the number of times I was bumped into, elbowed, pushed what not. It's like college had just let out or something. I figure this place makes a much better weeknight bar than weekend but the people watching was interesting. Drinks are solid, though I wish I had free will to punch each jerk off that just showed zero respect for anyone as they made their way through the crowds.
author: Kim N.

description: My kind of place to grab a drink. Good amount of space and seating. Good crowd. Not too overly packed. Good drinks. Good beer selection (was impressed by the options of belgian sour beers) No complaints. Would definitely be the kind  of place to meet up with friends/coworkers/a hot date! Would definitely go back again!
author: Judi B.

description:
This place delivers on decor. It has a rustic cabin vibe and has a mesmerizing ceiling (it has birds painted on it). I went to Bloodhound one day after work, so I wasn't surprised to see the bar filled with a bunch of young professionals. 

I ordered the Pisco Punch, which was served in a mason jar (which, from what I could tell, all the drinks are). Dear heaven on earth, the Pisco Punch was DELICIOUS. When I go to a new  bar I usually try at least two drinks and never repeat an order. However, the Pisco Punch was so good that I couldn't  help myself and ended up ordering it twice. 

I will be back!
author: Abena O.

description:
I dig this place! 

I used to come here every now and then for a beer when I first moved to the city on Monday's or Tuesday's when I got off work since a couple friends of mine who live in the East Bay have those days off and apparently know the owner (the fact that they would actually drive into the city close to rush hour just to come here says a lot about this place in itself). 

I really like the atmosphere. It's divey, but not too divey, but it's not one of those bars that's nothing remotely like a dive, but thinks it would be "cool" if it's dive so it tries too hard (does that make any sense?). It's just an overall laid-back atmosphere. The decor is pretty cool (the ducks on the ceiling are a plus) and I really like the whole "rustic" feel." 

They have a great beer selection and I love the fact they serve them in mason jars! For no good reason really I've never tried any of the specialty drinks here even though they all sound delicious (I'm also a big fan of Hanger vodka, which they have). 

Another big plus about this place is that despite what you would think might be a tough area for parking, it's actually pretty easy (I've only been here on weekdays when I got off at work and since I don't live or work in the area that's a big plus to meeting up here). 

I think if I actually lived closer to Bloodhound (or even came to SOMA more often than I do) this would be a regular stop of mine, and would inch up closer to five star territory. Next time I come I gotta try a specialty drink!
author: George A.

description: I had an amazing time!! Toucan was my bartender and man does he know how to navigate that bar! I asked for a bourbon suggestion; he grabbed some amazing bourbon and turned it Into an old fashioned and I was not disappointed!! It was also so cool to see that the barback, Jason, was very attentive to my needs. He kept my water glass full and kept me entertained as I waited for my friends!! I will definitely be back!!
author: Heidi H.

description:
Oddball little bar that, at least on Saturday night, was packed full of hipsters.... loud as hell and twice as crowded! Seems to be going for some kind of "redneck" theme judging by the wooden decor and the "big game hunter" arcade game.

We also got jostled a fair amount due to the packed nature of the place.

That said, the beer was tasty and the bartenders were very helpful when I went back in to try to recover my sunglasses, even offering to call me if they found them. And it is at this point that I have to be thankful for the hipsters and their boney... selves, as a dude managed to sit in the chair where my sunglasses had fallen out without touching them at all! Good thing I didn't lose them in an Applebee's...
author: Carl W.

description: Being a lover of anything involving Campari, it's all about Bloodhound's rum Negroni. Like Penny Lane once said, "Give it a try, it'll change your life."
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Even before moving to the neighborhood, Bloodhound was the stuff of legend.

It's got that warm hunting lodge look and feel and carefully walks the line between svelte hipster bar and locals dive scene.  You can try any of the delicious (usually) bourbon based libations or go for a good ol glass of beer.  The selections on both are pretty great with the bartenders definitely paying attention to their craft.  Its tough to gauge a good night to come since weekends at just about any good bar are packed and random weekdays are prone to infestations of the start-up faux hipster crowd doing their post-work happy hour thing but overall this is my go to spot for enjoying a drink in the 'hood.

This place is quickly ascending the list of my favorite bars in SF.
author: Steven R.

description:
Bloodhound was an unexpected surprise. At a quick glance from the outside, I had just thought it was a local dive bar. Boy was I wrong.

The inside is western-themed, their music is rad, and the drinks taste great. I can't wait to go back again.
author: Kyle D.

description: I work near here and this is by far my favorite HH spot for a real cocktail! The bartenders and typically pretty quick and the drinks are tasty. They also allow me to bring my pup with me from work which is definitely a plus!! Good mix of people here in the after-work crowd and not dressy or pretentious.
author: Emily T.

description:
I love this bar.  Usually don't travel to the SOMA unless we visit a homie that lives a few blocks away, but this bar is awesome. Decor is will remind you of a American country cabin with its wooden interior, brews served up in mason jars, and copious styles of whiskey.

Sorta divey, but nicer. Bartenders are usually pretty friendy, great artisan cocktails, and if you thought hipsters only congregated in the mission, then you ain't seen nuthin' yet!

What's awesome is that they have Buck Hunter. nuff said....
author: Nicky N.

description:
Amazing/original cocktails
Great mix of music
Cool decor, with a warm/divey feel without feeling gritty 
Diverse crowd
Friendly staff
Knowledgeable bartenders

But above all
The Deerhunter Game is what puts this place at #1 in the area for me.
author: Hannah B.

description:
My favorite San Francisco bar, hands down.  Didn't even mind the drunk college kids who used me as a post to lean up and make out against..  Coolest bartenders and without being kiss a's the nicest folks that have a keen interest for booze!  That is an a f'in plus to me.  Oh yeah, and no one wears those stupid, embarrassing vests "mixologists" wear.  Amen.  

So, if you enjoy a laid back bar with cool bartenders go, if not go somewhere you can get your a$$ kissed and leave the awesome bars for the rest of us.
author: Zenobia R.

description:
Very neat bar on the edge of Soma. 

The decor alone sold this place to me immediately, and the fact that I found this little place in an area I usually tend to avoid made me happy. Pool table, buck hunter, earthy and rustic decor with that Brooklyn hipster vibe, bloodhound emits the whole "I don't really give a damn" vibe. 

Bartenders were super cool, I think cute? I don't remember, they got us pretty hammered. Great custom drinks if you want, and FRANZISKANER (yay!), and immediate win in my drunk bitch book.
author: Meredith M.

description: Interesting interior.  FULL bar.  Casual.  More of a beer place for bikers than scotches for suits.
author: Kristen S.

description: My favorite neighborhood bar! Staff is friendly, not too crowded, not too loud, perfect spot for Thursday drinks and a round of pool :) Pricing is reasonable. Ambiance and music really cool. Style is casual.
author: Kristina T.

description: I am not a local.  Came to SF for Dreamforce conference.  My friends and I really enjoyed the great beer selection at this bar, and I felt comfortable there.  I came back to have a drink by myself, relax and WORK. I went outside to have a smoke, I asked the "doorman" how far away I needed to stand to smoke.  He told me to stand past the ashtray on the sidewalk, which I did.  A few minutes later a drunk girl knocked the ashtray over and stood it up 3 feet away from where it was originally standing. The "doorman" called me names and told me I was an idiot and other patrons collaborated with him on something none of them had witnessed.  Even though the drunk girl made every attempt to tell him what really happened.  I was humiliated and made to feel very uncomfortable.  I will NEVER spend another dollar here nor will I recommend this establishment to my friends and/or collegues.  He called me "lady" (not in a nice way,) the little guy outside told me "not to fuck with his dude" and the drunk girl played dumb.  Lame bar.  Don't spend your money here.
author: Leanna H.

description:
Very laid back place.  Cool scene and happy hour on Saturday :)

Dog friendly too with a beer list which always seems to have something new on it I haven't tried before.
author: Brett B.

description:
Fun,
loud,
albeit simultaneously
'laid back'.
Good service,
good music,
and...
If there wasn't a hint of pretentiousness from the mixoligists...  Automatic 5...
Simply one subjective opinion...
and... 
It's not saying much... 
but...
I'm an easy 5-star sell.
author: Barry A.

description:
Bloodhound is great! The drinks are pretty strong so definitely worth the money. Their special drinks are particularly good, so try those (and the mason jars they use are cute too). Good beers on tap too, and the bartenders are friendly and willing to help you choose something and explain what's what.

The atmosphere was enjoyable as well, laid back but lively. And close to Bart!
author: Daniella D.

description:
The boys did it again...these guys opened another gorgeous bar with the right ambiance which welcomes all facets of SF inhabitants. 

Video games in the corner and a pool table, too. In the front there are loungy cushy couches and coffee tables right next to stools and bar tables along the wall.  They don't typically go together but here it all meshes perfectly.

Add a well selected liquor collection and you have a chill and yummy bar.
author: Jay H.

description:
I like the decor on the walls.  I like that there are couches and plenty of bar stools, but that it's mostly standing room.  I've never had an issue with a bartender. 

Other than that, I'm not sure why people keep going to this place.  Ambiance is not that great, crowd is boring and not diverse in the least, there's not enough bartenders on staff, and drinks are overpriced.  You can't hear any music, but at the same time, it's usually too loud to hear the person next to you talk.  

So-so and uninteresting.
author: Deep P.

description:
Nothing makes me feel more like I need an episode of intervention than a trip to SF. In fact, that's generally the reason why I don't have a ton of San Francisco reviews despite my many trips here - it's all a blur.

With that disclaimer in mind, this review may not be the most detailed or coherent in the world, but I can assure you, I fucking love this bar. 

Why? Well, here's where it all gets hazy. A few reasons off the top of my head:
-Old Speckled Hen served in mason jars... and only $5!
-I usually stay at a hotel near this hood where there is a dearth of cool bars.
-It's dark.
-There's a good amount of seating.
-Music is good.
-They have just a really cool aesthetic. 

Yeah, I'm kind of stretching here. But here's the thing, you can say Ryan Gosling is cool because he's good looking, and he's in a band, and he generally chooses good roles, and he owns 300 hipster v-necks... but you know those aren't the reasons WHY he's cool... he just is. The same goes for Bloodhound.

(Look, I warned you it was going to be semi-coherent.)
author: Hazel Q.

description:
I've been wanting to check out Bloodhound for so long!! Love the decor in here, especially the flock of birds on the ceiling!

Crazy strong drinks (might be too strong for the faint of heart or taste) on a delicious sounding drink menu. I had the recoil - ginger beer and elderflower being two of my favorite things - and it was really tasty!

Nice bartenders who will remake a drink for you if you didn't like it the first time around.

My only complaint is the one stall for the ladies restroom, c'mon now.
author: Kim-van T.

description: Came in a few Saturdays ago for the first time. Loved the decor and my beer was good (I'm a sucker for the mason jars). It was super crowded, so obviously it's going to be loud but they had the music turned up SO loud we could barely hear each other. Minus one star for that, minus one star for the bartender being super rude and snapping at my friend just because she raised her hand to flag him down after being ignored for 15 minutes. I think I'll be back, but probably either way earlier or later in the evening.
author: Brittnee P.

description:
If you've always dreamed of hanging log-cabin style, with birds overhead and taxidermed game adorning the surrounding walls, Bloodhound is the 
solution.

The other night I walked into this redneck junk-tion. High class funk-tion. On a rendezvous with some buddies. On the ceilings, airbrushed sparrows (put a bird on it) decorated the walls above and then at the bar, the very wooden bar, all sorts of lumberjack looking bartenders appeased my whiskey order. 

If you're looking for that bar where you can metaphorically admire the star-studded sky and think about buffalo running wild, Bloodhound makes you feel like you've drunkenly arrived. So, takeaways include: crafty cocktails, wooded bar, log cabin city respite, and the best place to go when you're in the surrounding Mission.
author: Monica S.

description:
***Good***
Ambiance, decor, cocktail menu. They also have a usually fun beer (draught and bottle) selection; not large, but solid quality.

***Bad***
Can take a while to get a drink some times. 

***Recommendation***
Whiskey cocktail, or semi-rare beer on draught.
author: Nick K.

description:
Work trips to San Francisco have taken on certain patterns: 
1. Attend training sessions in the mornings. 
2. Grab coffee and catch up with coworkers I rarely see. 
3. Get my ear talked off by bossman. 
4. Have lunch at the Sentinel or Algiers. 
5. Go for drinks at Bloodhound.
Rinse, repeat, and wish for more of 5 during steps 1-4.

If I lived in the city I'd definitely be a regular here at Bloodhound. It's just my kind of bar - laidback and unassuming, but carrying an interesting selection of beers and spirits for a bar its size. Old Speckled Hen at $5 a pint? Yes please. House special cocktails for under $10. Yes please x2. I don't know how well this rustic-chic look and feel fits in SOMA, but, really, I don't care. Plus the bartenders are friendly and efficient, which is ... a plus. That's two plusses bookending that sentence. How quaint. Why edit it when I can comment on it further.

Anyway. Bloodhound. I have no wish to quit you. We've got a good thing goin', friendo.
author: Mike Q.

description:
Super chill bar conveniently located near my place of work. Reasonable prices, good set of beers on tap, friendly bartenders. Good music, nice ambiance, plenty of seating. 

Haven't tried any of the mixed drinks but from the looks of it I may have to give some of the whiskey libations a whirl.
author: Leigh W.

description:
This place is pretty sure.  It's not the best place to go for a drink, but it gets the job done when you're in SOMA.  Nothing to write home about though in my book.

The drinks here in my experience are not very good-they are strong enough, but they never taste as good as some other places.  When I go to a chill bar like this, I want my drinks to be a little tastier cause I'm not getting wasted to drown out the taste)

The sitting area in the front is very nice and comfortable...great for a late night drink with friends or a date.
author: Kat D.

description:
Fun bar, can always find a designer or two here. They have a great hunting arcade game in the back. This is great for those who take it seriously and those who are feeling pretty good after a few drinks. They also have a pool table in the back but you will find it very difficult to play when the bar is full.

Stay away from the bathroom, its disgusting.
author: Kevin K.

description:
The decor of this place is out of this world. It's got a kinda rustic vibe that is hip beyond comparison. This place might be too cool for me. Anyways, the vibe is amazing and the drinks are rather interesting. It was kinda fun trying each one, but beware of the ginger one. If you've ever had chinese medicine, its kinda like that.

My only downside is that it was ridiculously crowded. Maybe because there was a game on TV or maybe because it was a Friday night and everyone needed to get a drink. Either way, I would come back. Hands down.
author: Jessica H.

description:
It looks like a Saloon on the outside.  When I walked in, I kept staring at their ceiling.  Decor is..different; it's a man's bar minus the flock of birds!  Just a kicked back bar that offers interesting cocktails.  It wasn't a meat market; it wasn't even that packed the night we checked it out.  

Please note - they don't serve any food.  Good thing Radius is around the corner.  You can order some fried chicken after wards!
author: Diana M.

description:
If I were to tell you how close I am to this bar, well, then you'd know where I live. Let's just say, pretty damn close and therefore am a regular visitor. I keep a low profile, I'm not trying to be pretentious by knowing the bartenders, but all roommates and friend's are fans. And can't forget the memorable photography of SF Street Food Festival Scavenger Hunt our group pulled off or the joys of playing Buck Hunt. 

Give me my Makers and Ginger, I'm a happy FolSoManer.
author: Alita M.

description: A good business move would be to replace the big buck arcade game with a table.  They got a lot of drinks though. That's all I got sorry.
author: Eddie S.

description: The drinks served here are awesome! They are very strong.  I had the "Recoil" and was very buzzed after drinking it.  All drinks are around $9 each.  The bar has a bit of a hipster -ish atmosphere.  It's a fun place to go out and hang with friends before hitting other places.  Tends to get a bit loud on weekend nights, but that s expected for a bar.  Will def. come again to try the other drinks on the menu.
author: Patty O.

description: Yup, this is officially one of my new favorite bars in the city. The mixed cocktails are really fresh and delicious (reminds me a bit of Rickhouse on Kearny in the Financial District), and the general vibe is very chill. A mix between a dive/hipster/no category bar. Pool table and arcade video game. Not crowded at all on the earlier side, once it hits 1030, it does become quite a bit more crowded -- just need to plan accordingly. :)
author: Mel G.

description:
Though poorly marked from the street, I will forgive that since the interior was so lovely! Very spacious and light. I really loved the look of the tall wood tables.

If you are a whisky person, this will be your heaven. Also seemed to have a good beer selection.

I wish more bars in SF were like Bloodhound because it didn't feel like there was a particular scene there and there was enough space to just hang out with my friends (as opposed to feeling packed into a sardine can like at some places in the Mission).

I would definitely come back here! Also, parking was SUPER easy.
author: Nora S.

description:
yelp / your location is in the wrong spot!!!! 

this cool bar is next to raven.  yelp dropped the market next to the auto place oil can henry.

love the drinks- many good options and a good strong selection of whiskey/bourbon cocktails on the menu.  

the place is a bit set for mission type folks, and the occasional infiltration of techies.  I guess my group fell into the latter.
author: Mabel F.

description: First off, they have Pappy!  What's more, their whiskey selection is stupendous.  The vibe was great, mostly a younger crowd.  The bartender was a nice guy too.
author: Chris G.

description:
Like everyone's said, this place looks cool and has dead animal skulls--score! Wide liquor selection, pool table, no lines for the ladies' room. I subtract one star because I ordered a Yamizaki on the rocks and it didn't taste like it-- I drink it often so  I wonder if it was something terrible like a blended scotch. Also, the music is cool but there's no place to dance-- it's a good place to start off and move onto something else for shimmying. Unless of course pool is your thing, which is mine even though I'm mediocre, then you can play that to the bitter end when the uptight bouncer tells you it's time to leave at the end of the night.
P.S. They also have Old Speckled Hen--on tap! It's like butter beer, yum!
author: Alex S.

description:
I don't leave the Mission very often (or, maybe more accurately, I don't leave Mistro PoBern very often), but I came to Bloodhound with a friend a few weeks ago, and I am a little in love. I would go out of my way to come here anytime but the best part is that it's not really out of the way. A few blocks from Civic Center Bart? A bike ride from my work in Potrero?  

The decor is misappropriated frontier-pioneer objects without the Manifest Destiny bullshit, the bartenders were super friendly (saved me from drinking an 11% alchohol beer without making me feel like a rube), and I think the best part is that they keep the bar incredibly clean by immediately picking up straws, napkins, etc.  So damn good.
author: Ivy S.

description:
- Great ambiance: beers served in Mason jars, deer head fixtures on the wall, salvaged wood craft counters. Also video games in the back. 
- Walking distance to BART and close to freeway entrances
- Friendly bar staff
- Large, clean bathrooms
- Ample seating on overstuffed chairs and couches; you're basically going to a caribou lodge to kick back a beer
- I just adore this place. A win for SOMA!
author: liz c.

description:
Best place to warm up and hang out in that neighborhood!
Cozy interior, fun bartender, mellow crowd, an entire wall of seemingly endless selection of specialty liquors!
author: Kali F.

description:
Yep - a solid bar.  Read the other reviews for a sense of the hip crowd, lodge decor and to hear about the strong selection of upscale booze and the cocktails.  As to the beer on tap -- impressive.  Impressive for both the breadth and depth of selection covered across 10 taps.  

Sporting 2 offerings from San Diego's Stone brewery -- their Pale Ale and the 'enjoy by 12-21-12' Double IPA.  Ballast Point Big Eye, another San Diego IPA rounds out the hoppy beers.  Nice.

A couple of seasonals -- Anchor's Christmas Ale and the Belgian Delirium Noel will help you find the that holiday spirit.  Drake's Stout gives you another dark selection.

Two Belgian styles -- PranQster Golden (CO) & Allagash White (ME) -- are friendly choices, along with England's Old Speckled Hen.  The 10th tap serves a lager - Berkeley's Trumer Pils.

A FIVE PINT salute to the Bloodhound's beer offering.
author: Mark S.

description:
"What whiskey will not cure, there is no cure for"
-Irish Proverb

That makes Bloodhound like your friendly neighborhood doctor's office.  The owner, the bartender with the awesome stache, is the gatekeeper to all that ails you.  Drop-in hours are ALL THE TIME. How convenient is that? With no appointment needed, there's no excuse not to get a regular check-up.

Medications include Bulleit Bourbon for malaise, Laphoraig for fatigue, and Maker's for inhibition.  Co-pays at Bloodhound are low, and other patients at the bar often pick up the bill on your behalf!  And you know your doctor is quality when there's a pool table (exam table?), cabin-like waiting area, and taxidermy (to make you feel lucky to be alive.)

Guess my biannual medical check-ups will soon become biweekly (or more!) Which means that I may be showing up more frequently at my actual internist's to have my albumin levels monitored.
author: Joanna M.

description:
Two words. Buck hunter. I def spent an epic afternoon here after a giants game. I have literally been searching for a bar that has ths game as the only other one I had been able to find was in SC at the boardwalk. We got there right as it opend and had the place to ourselves. The bar was clean, the bartender was nice, and the drinks were strooong. Def made my BART ride home a lil more enteraining than I had planned. 
Didn't really see any other people in the bar before we left so can't comment on that but so far I heart and will be making this a repeat destination.
author: Meg N.

description: The vibe is ok, but whatever you do, don't waste your money on the specialty cocktails,I tasted two and both of them tasted like cough syrup! If you want to try a unique mixed drink, go next door to Raven.
author: David Y.

description:
Solid bar. Great bartenders, a funny ass doorman. He messed with me because I had a paper ID from Oregon but he was cool about it. 

The decor is right on. Not too much, not too little, tasteful and natural. That dog roaming around is pretty bad ass too.

I will return!
author: Philip K.

description:
I've been to Bloodhound a few times now, and it never fails to be a good time.  They have a great selection of beer, wine, hard stuff, you name it; and a great low-key vibe.   

The decor is country bar meets hipster, with leather chairs, wooden bar height tables, and pretty cool bird stencils on the ceiling.  They have BIG BUCK HUNTER! and a pool table.
author: Kalah A.

description:
Went last night during happy hour, and this is definitely in my top 5 favorite bars in SF so far (only been here a few months, but trust me, I've been busy doing lots of research...) Amazing whiskey selection (and liquor selection in general). Great atmosphere - a relaxed, cabin-y feel, nice open layout, and Buck Hunter to boot. Bartenders were great and the crowd was a good mix of hipsters, locals, and after-work types. Kind of a solid, clean dive bar feel - the kind of place you feel really comfortable in, but aren't afraid to use the bathroom.

The cocktail menu was truly impressive, and I say that as an ex-bartender. I'm usually an old-fashioned girl and definitely enjoyed their "New Fashioned" with maple simple syrup, but the bourbon cocktail with ginger beer and elderflower liqueur was one of the best drinks I've ever had, hands down.

They had a DJ spinning vinyl (on a Tuesday night!), which was awesome, but it still kept a very chill vibe. I'll be back, many many times, I'm sure.
author: Rachael K.

description: Extensive list of whiskey cocktails and laid back atmosphere.  Not the best whiskey sour I've ever had, but am game to try one of their signature cocktails in the future!
author: Susan Y.

description:
I keep thinking I'm not cool enough for Bloodhound.  It's my tattoo envy.  

No - really.  I will never have a tattoo, partially because I've never really gotten along with pain or needles and partially because I live in lurking fear that whatever I ended up permanently inking on my body would turn out to be super, duper dorky.  So every time I see a cool or witty or interesting tattoo, my inner dork sighs and turns green.

What does this have to do with Bloodhound?  Have you seen their ceiling decor?  It reminded me of a big tattoo the first time I walked in.  My inner dork sighed.

Beyond that, Bloodhound gives off this vibe of being always a bit in the know and quietly cool, sort of like all those people I know with witty and interesting artwork on their bodies.  I don't know how Bloodhound does this, because the crowd is frequently post-work FiDi (not really what I think of as 'edgy').  But somehow the bar maintains a low key, interesting vibe, even when packed with people at 6pm on Thursday.

I come here more and more often because it offers decent wines at a very decent price for me (hallelujah!) with a full bar for friends who prefer cocktails.  The interior is usually roomy (except when the post-work crew descends) and the bartenders are low key.  So despite the tiny internal crisis every time I come here, it's well worth the visit.  Even if I have to speak sternly to the inner dork...
author: Suzanne B.

description: Fantastic bar located on Folsom right near Basil Thai restaurant (a great place to go to dinner beforehand!) Bloodhound has no cover, is spacious, and has this cool dim decor. There are high tables in the back where you can chill at, and getting drinks isn't that challenging at all. They have a bunch of interesting drinks/shots that are the bar's signature drinks, be sure to check those out. It does get packed on Friday/Sat nights, so be cautious of this. Just make sure you come early enough, like 10/10:30pm and you'll be fine. You can easily stay here the whole night and you won't get bored. There are mason jars, birds on the ceiling, interesting chandeliers (I think horns/antlers), and dim lighting, like I said. It feels very antique, but not in a run-down way. It's kept really nice and modern and new- definitely go!
author: Priya G.

description:
Crows and antlers abound, have yourself a wood laden hotspot with expert drink makers offering outstanding cocktails that make me believe SF may possibly have the best tasting drinks in all Cali. 

Hot. Sophisticated. Crowded. So recommended.
author: Champ M.

description: Super cool interior. Excellent lighting... packed at 7pm on a friday =( but the bartenders quickly served everyone. Looking forward to going back and playing deer hunt.
author: Emily D.

description:
Awe-Some!

Definitely a cool little local watering hole that makes you feel like a regular the moment you enter it's cozily lighted den of delight. I loved the decor, especially the spray painted birds all over the ceiling (an idea I may very well steal for a room in my home someday). I thought the bartenders were super friendly and the Greyhound I ordered was one of the best I've ever had. The grapefruit juice was perfectly tart, but not too sour. After ordering it, I noticed the Bloodhound spin on the Greyhound and tried that, but have to say the Campari kinda ruined it for me, so I will stick with the original.

This is certainly a bar I will be coming back to. Mos' Def!
author: Stephy S.

description: As a lover of all things cozy, Bloodhound is the hipster bar for me. With antler chandeliers and plenty of surfaces covered in wood and dark leather, I wanted to snuggle up in a corner with a good book, alas the general activities of a buzzin' bar prevented that from happening. However, I did manage a cocktail and a ringside seat at Big Buck Hunter. I simply said "I'll have what they're having," when I ordered, but I think it was a New Manhattan. Regardless, it was well executed and delivered quickly. The also have a nice beer list and a pool table. My visit was on a Sunday, and it wasn't too crowded, but definitely not dead. It's a comfortable spot for cocktail and beer lovers to snuggle up.
author: Misti Y.

description:
I can't pinpoint what I like most--the Mason jars (hey, a lady's gotta have her Mason jar), the I-can't-figure-out-how-they-painted-that ceiling with Poe-esque in-flight ravens, the ambiance (interesting without trying too hard), or the legit beverages. Our most recent visit had me ordering an Allagash tripel. The only other local place I could find that beer was in the over-priced, over-refrigerated beer aisle in Whole Foods. Of course, you can have your fancy-pants beer while ordering a rum and coke next. Seems like all drinks are welcome here. Also, no cover. 

Downside: can get packed (is that really a downside at a bar?).
author: Amanda B.

description:
Bloodhound is one of my go to watering holes in SOMA. The cool, laid back hunting lodge themed bar has everything my heart desires: amazing cocktails and a Big Buck Hunter arcade game. Little known fact about me? I am a great shot. Well, only when I'm behind a fake rifle. I've never tried to shoot a real gun. But yeah, if you're ever up for challenging me to a game, meet me here. They've also got a pool table with an antler chandelier that I adore hanging above it. But I'm only okay at pool.

There's a lovely selection of specialty cocktails offered here, but the bartenders will whip you up whatever you'd like. Whether it's more spirit or fruit forward, sweet, tart, etc. Just let them know your liquor base of choice and leave the rest up to the pros. I am a big fan of the Recoil and New Fashioned, both bourbon drinks. They also have a great selection of beer on tap, which they serve in mason jars. 

Not only are seats usually plentiful at the bar and by the windows, but the parking around here is super easy too. There's free street parking right out front, which is perfect, especially if you want to hit the place up early. If you head over around 6pm, you might find me there channeling Sarah Palin.
author: Connie C.

description: Awesome bar, great for happy hour and I can bring the puppy! Their specialty cocktails are yummy, especially anytihing with tequila in it.  The bartenders are cool and friendly, and theres usually a mellow crowd in there. They have buck hunter, which is kinda the greatest game ever.....a pool table, and they're next to one of my favorite thai restaurants in the city.
author: Rad S.

description: nice evening, not that personal.  Reasonable vibe, very friendly door staff
author: Sophie M.

description:
Love this new SOMA bar and it's roomy feel. It was pretty crowded on a Saturday night, but with the long tables against the wall there is lots of room. We were able to score two tables for our crew to mingle.

The bartenders were helpful and friendly and it wasn't hard to get a drink. The boys loved the shooting game and pool table. I enjoyed the wood-slatted walls, redwood tables, the antlers, and the classy yet hunting lodge kind of feel. The crowd felt a little marina-style, but since this was a meeting place for our group, we made it our own. I like bars that have a vibe laid back enough for you to meet up with friends, chill with drinks, and not feel like your part of a concept.

Will come back.

Good stiff drinks and a nice selection of Belgian beers.
author: Nikki M.

description: Always busy on a Friday for happy hour nice crowd. strong drinks . Wish they would open before 3pm on the weekend
author: Fiona R.

description: I like coming here from across the street after City Beer Store closes. It's pretty relaxed and not too snobbish, with a good selection of beers.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Sometimes I don't understand how places can get SO LOUD. Every time I come here, I feel like I have to scream in people's faces. But thank goodness Bloodhound makes this easy to achieve by offering fancy stiff cocktails balanced with not-as-stiff ingredients. Being loud is just a natural progression of inebriation. 

I always go back for the Recoil. And I gotta try the Bloodhound (vodka, campari, grapefruit) next time. 

And finally! A cocktail place that opens at 4pm! Good to know.

3.5 - but the drinks are good so I'll round up.
author: Faffy L.

description:
They have TVs in there? Apparently I'm always ending my night here, and not starting it. 

This place kind of feels like a saloon, but if David Lynch decorated it. I mean that in a good way.

The first time I came here, it started out with a very light crowd, then about 30-60 minutes later you could barely walk through the place, and then 60-120 minutes later, everyone left. Don't quote me on those times. But yeah, the number of people is very much in flux here. During that crowded phase, a smoker friend and another friend went outside, you know, to have a smoke. Then they couldn't get back in because they were told it was too crowded. They had to argue with the bouncer that they were 'just' inside and all their friends were in there. This was hilarious at the time. 

Not only will I be back, I already have been back. As a matter of fact, I wanted to stop in tonight before the Psychedelic Furs show over at Slim's, but didn't get my ass moving fast enough.
author: Ken L.

description: Great bar, very open and chill.  The decor is cool and its very spacious inside.  bartenders are awesome and make great drinks.  Definitely the place to go if you want a laid back place to chill with friends!
author: Terence N.

description:
Bloodhound is a great landing spot for a chill night with friends.  Not the typical SOMA pretentious crowd and it's easy to get a beer at the bar.  They have Big Buck Hunter and my roommate shot a perfect round and went 30/30 in the bonus - bring it.

Pro-tip:  Just one pool table so get in line.
author: Nick H.

description:
A great bar in SOMA with a lot of space and great atmosphere. I come here every so often, and I have never had a bad experience.

Their handcrafted drinks are top top. Order the Recoil.

Apologies if you were there when this happened: On my birthday my friend bought me a bottle of cologne, I grabbed it from him and it slipped from my hands, shattering all over the floor. We left immediately.

My only gripe about this bar is the bathroom is crammed, with no lock on the door. So, If someone happens to be dropping the kids off, you'll walk right in on him. Would be much better if it was a single stall with a lock. -1

Sorry, I just prefer privacy in the bathroom.

No DJ or anything. There's music. Not really a bar for dancing. Great place to hang out!
author: Harold C.

description:
Oh come on.. you can fit another monkey in the barrel can't you?.. 

I knew that to write an actual Review (I use a capitol R to differentiate between a well thought out, researched, and based upon MY actual experiences review rather than either highly emotional babble or a summary of those who have written before me type review) I would have to experience Bloodhound on a busy weekend night. To be honest and true to my review I even went in... Alone! 

I've always been impressed with Bloodhound. It was opened not too too long ago by a couple guys from Double Dutch and Ambassador. The name Bloodhound is originally an alias for the St Hubert (or Sleuthhound) dog. Though it is doubtful that that fact is why they allow K9 pets to roam as free about the floors of the bar as the beautifully painted black doves artistically appear to be doing across and around the ceiling. Bloodhound dogs were bred to to help hunters track deer and were rather homily pups quite honestly.

Bloodhound bar, unlike its namesake, is gorgeous. Repurposed wood panels the wall, paintings of bears and antler chandiliers are included in the decorations. The look is hunting lodge chic. There are high top wooden tables, bar stools, and comfy couches placed strategically near the front of the venue to take pressure off the bar itself.. But my favorite outside the dove colored ceiling is the lighting. The antler chandilier is very hip, but look again. The light bulb chandiliers (over the hightops) are too cool. I want them. And even the track lighting over the bar is both artistic and original.

The $9 coctail list is creative, not a renaming of the same cocktails every other bar serves but Bloohound originals with names like the Ricky Ricardo, the Recoil, Jack Rose, and of course, the Bloodhound- imagine that! Beers will run you @ $5-$7 but they are nice enough to list the alcohol percentage right next to the name. 

After purchasing a Daq 1515, I picked a corner to observe from, wanting not only to check out the video game "Big Buck Hunter" (an awesome shooting game) but what kinda tunes were on the juke box (it was turned off for the night but it looks like a blend of bar favorites). I looked out over a sea of mason jars (in 2 sizes), martini glasses (specialty cocktails), and wine glasses (primarily containing extra strength beer) and realized how much more I loved Bloodhound after my mandatory Friday night visit. The crowd was more- well for lack of a bettert word- real than i'd seen on a Friday night in a SF watering hole in, well too long. There really was a bit of everyone. Every where you looked were flip flops and jeans. The ladies had on casual make up and down played hair. The men's pants were neither too big, nor too small. And it even looked like someone took a handful of UC Berkley boys and dropped them in for artistic flavor. My favorite foursome were the 21 years old girls -feigning nonchalance in a bar full of late 20's and 30 somethings. It was impossible to tell who was hip, who was professional, and who was on the prowl (except the 21 year olds of course). It was comfortable. And that C word I almost never use. I actually believe if Toby Keith's famous "I Love This Bar" had begun playing at 1:30 am Sat morning, that if by the 2nd verse, after the left right looks to see how all the other patrons were reacting were done, this crowd would've known the words and sung them proud.

Well I know one thing for sure... "I Love this Bar"!

Ps the male bartender was impressive- to say the least. And the female. I think Genuwine wrote a song about her that had a line "Is there any more room for me, in those jeans". She was HOT.. and yes I'm as straight as an arrow.. :-)
author: Lisa H.

description:
For a start to your magnificent evening in San Francisco, start with a few drinks at this joint. I've been here only a handful of times, but Bloodhound consistently attracts a crowd of individuals which I tend to enjoy. I don't find it pretentious or yuppy, but it's certainly not in the drags like some of the dive bars you'll find in the area. 

As for the drink selection...it's decent. I don't head to this place because of their spread, but they do serve some quality beers and unique thirst-quenchers.

I haven't stayed Bloodhound past 11PM, but for a place to get a "taste", it's a win.
author: Jason C.

description:
After a weird, long, and stressful day, I ended up at a dive pool bar called Club 93 last night.  Shot some fun pool and then ended up hitting Bloodhound afterwards with a new friend that I had been shooting pool with.

I'm sure those who know me on Yelp will most certainly smile when they hear that I went to Bloodhound.  I mean...how could I not love a place with birds painted on the ceiling? :) 

Hung out, shot some great pool, played a girl who takes bar pool far too seriously (lighten up, Wendy...it's supposed to be fun!).  Interesting decor with a midwestern feel.  Those horn chandeliers always make me think of that scene from that film The Lost Boys.

Had three Ketel Citron and sodas and one Bloodhound which was made with Hangar 1, Campari, and grapefruit.  The bartenders were cool (forgot the big guy's name), but I'm just not a fan of Campari.  I should have ordered a Greyhound instead.  Looking forward to trying some of their other drinks in the future...maybe a Ricky Ricardo next time.  

Fun, friendly place with a good crowd...I even got to pet a cute dog inside named "Lizzie", right before I ran into a co-worker there.  That was a real surprise and totally unexpected.  Was tempted to hit some other bars afterwards with him, but hadn't had dinner yet and was hungry.

Nice place to hang with no pretense.  I will be back.
author: Roy N.

description:
Awesome interior, good beer but a little limited on the seating which made the place a madhouse!

I would absolutely go back here, though I'd make sure to get here early. My friends and I arrived around 9ish, and all four or five seating areas were taken. The place could use a few more tables, especially considering how much open space it has. Even with all of the seating taken, the place was still pretty empty. However, just as we began contemplating a new bar (around 10), the place exploded with people, including a party bus with a bachelorette party. Even without the wedding-goers, it would have been nuts. Took a REALLY long time to get a drink at that point, but the bartenders seemed to be doing their best.

Inside it felt like a cabin, with wood  throughout. In a good way. And the ceiling was painted to look like birds were potentially attacking the drunks inside. Also had a single pool table in the back that never seemed to be available.

Final word: Cool bar, but get there EARLY!
author: Jeff D.

description:
I knew that this place opened recently and I'm so glad I got the chance to finally go - it's great!

I've been to a ton of bars around the city and this one is really unique...it really is for everyone:

It's not divey, it's not too loungey, not a pub, not a club...it really is its own thing.  Bloodhound has a hunting/outdoors theme, but it's done nicely with earthy tones and accents.  While you'd expect a place like that to be divey and dirty, it's not - it is rustic, but it's intentional and not overdone.  It's clean and comfortable; there's also a lot of space and the staff there is friendly and attentive.

Most bars in this part of Folsom are either leather, hipster, divey or a combination of any of those three things, but this place really does stand out on its own.

Bloodhound, thanks for being original!
author: Ken G.

description:
My favorite bar in SF.  Period.

From the fantastic bartenders, to the spot on drinks, to the shockingly reasonable prices for the gouge fest that has become SOMA, this is the only spot you should be spending time in.

The decor fits the vibe they are going for perfectly.  If you know the story behind it the vintage wood planks, its even better.  It would be like giving away the end of a movie in a review, so ask someone who works there about it sometime.

The boys have done a great job here, if you are in the area, you are doing yourself a disservice if you haven't been.  Grab a beer in the canning jars your Grandma uses, shoot some ducks in duck hunter, play some pool, and just chill.  Great spot, vibe, music, etc, etc.

(Mike/Darin - Miss you guys already!)
author: Andrew M.

description:
Finally writing a review for Bloodhound after coming here for the past 2+ years.  By far my favorite bar in SF.  

I keep coming back because the management / staff at this bar treats their customers like family.  Very friendly and they care about your bar experience.  It never takes more than 5 minutes to order and get a drink and their drinks are always made right.  Oh, they also serve their drinks in mason jars, how can you not love a bar that does that?

The space is uniquely decorated, people here are diverse, and being a big fan of whiskey and Scotch, offers a huge variety.  Also ask for Christina to help you with drinks.  She is an amazing bartender that not only makes a great cocktail, but has dropped some serious knowledge on bourbons.  If you are unsure what you want, she helps you decide based on your preferences and is never impatient about it.  Lastly, she introduced to me/makes a great mezcal shooter that is amazing!   Definitely worth a try if you are already a fan of peaty scotch!
author: Peter T.

description: We ended up at Blood Hound after the Elite event at Pedro's. Its a nice little neighborhood bar. They have a Big Buck Hunter Game and a Bar Pool Table. It reminds me of a hunting lodge. They serve Draft Beers in Mason Jars that pretty novel. Plenty of seating. Nice looking Bartenders and a Chill Vibe.
author: Eugene L.

description:
This review is based upon a 530pm midweek experience.  Met up with an old friend here who I had not seen in 4+ years, so we had lots of catching up to do.  Ergo, our venue criteria were:
1)  Avail seating:  Check!
2)  Noise-level to allow for normal conversation:  Check!
3)  Laid-back, non-sceney atmosphere:  Check!
4)  Friendly service:  Check!
5)  D-bag free patrons:  Check!

It was the perfect low-key, chill place with decent music and never a wait for the (nice & clean) restrooms, and since we were downing beers... well, you know...

Heads up that they don't serve real food (bartender offered up a choice of popcorn or beef jerky) & the wine selection is dismal, so if you want those features, go elsewhere.  The upside though is that the bar is apparently dog-friendly.  I spent a good 5 mins petting the adorable lab puppy whose parents were sitting next to us at the bar.
author: Jen H.

description:
This place fucking rocks
Drinks are delicious.. Wine pours are heavy
They have black birds painted on the ceiling! 
I love black birds!!

Seriously, one of the best times I've ever had in SF! 
So good I can barely remember details.. but trust me, it was FUN!
author: T C.

description: What a great little bar...cozy and comfortable with lots of seating and a pool table in the back. Amanda is a fantastic and super friendly bartender and will make you a killer cocktail. We had our company Christmas party here (yes I know it's March) and the whole staff was super attentive to detail and made everyone feel at home.
author: Amy K.

description:
Went here several weeks ago for a happy hour with the coworkers. And happy many hours were had. This is a chill place to go for drinks. I love the mason jars, it's been years since mason jars have been kitschy, but I still adore them. 

They also have a pool table in the back, which we used more like our couch to chat while sitting atop of. Mixed drinks were good. And what was awesome was... Chairman Bao was parked outside! We could walk out and get some grub to bring in, and it was delish!

I did learn here however that I hate IPAs.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Bloodhound is a nicer bar than what's around it, but rather than compare it to the rest of Folsom it's probably more apt to compare it to venues like Alembic, Blackbird, Bourbon and Branch, Nihon, Rickhouse, Rye, etc. And in that company Bloodhound fails to impress.  

While I had a pretty good drink here made with whiskey, ginger beer and lime, we felt that we had exhausted what was good about the cocktail menu after just 1 round.  

And the decor comes off feeling half way there.  

The wood work, rando dead animals and surfaces just seem dowdy and dreary.  The birds painted on the ceiling as the one contemporary element in the place would have looked great in a richer environment, but here they had me looking around for a wizard bong, dragon incense burner and old gateway desktop.  Slap up a poster of Jessica Alba and I've been in this house before.
author: Luke M.

description:
Another great spot for cocktails in SF. Bloodhound is a bit unique in that it's decorated like a hunting lodge -- think gun ranks & antlers. I was skeptical at first, but happy I gave it a shot because the cocktails are excellent!

Many of their libations are whiskey-based, but there also tend to be several tasty non-whiskey options as well. Try the Jack Rose or the Ward 8!
