And then, another time it must have been filming a new reality show entitled "SF's Next Top Hipster".  

All in all, it's a cool bar if you're in the mood for a western/ski lodge theme and you don't want to party somewhere with flashing strobe lights... but my advice is to have a friend go first and ask them how it is before going.
author: Toby C.

description:
GREAT neighborhood spot, clean, perfectly lit and absolutely unpretentious. Solid drinks, made with fresh squeezed juice should your drink require it, a pool table and SEATS!  

What's not to like?
author: Van T.

description:
i love that this bar is a few blocks away from home and right next to the french bistro truck.  A lot better than what used to be in this space (Cassidy's). Great drinks, hardworking bartenders (our bartender friday night did the bar round and didn't look up and added an extra drink w/o us having to repeat it), and I love the jars they put the beers in. 

It's where yuppies and hipsters converge.
author: Kris O.

description: It's such a chill place. If you go early enough, you can grab a seat at the booth along the wall. It's supposedly a whiskey bar, so they offered many types and kinds of whiskey. Making a decision at this place was hard. Also, they ran out of the moose drool, which I only wanted because of the name. I can definitely smell the whiskey from my boyfriend's drink, which is like a manhattan he said. Our group of 12 were comfortable getting drinks from the bar with no wait and sitting on the sofa. I like places that aren't super crowded you can't find a seat.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
When I say "as good as it gets," you need to understand that this is a neighborhood bar that really channels that vibe.... totally a SOMA meets hunting lodge meets Cheers style place.

Staff is cool as long as you are.  Be social.  You'll have a good time.  Speciality drinks are not always my favorite... but they are awesome and getting creative just for you.
author: Jake W.

description:
Sweet watering hole. Good selection of drinks... dark and rustic vibe (antlers included)... stuff you'll find elsewhere around the city, though not frequently enough and rarely as seamlessly put together. 

Most importantly, they have an unusually wide selection of Campari-based specialty drinks. Being a Campari maniac myself, I have to give "mad props" where "mad props" are due. I stuck to my usual on-the-rocks-with-a-twist version, which was addictive and delicious as usual, but I'm hoping to go back to give some of their fancy, more complex concoctions a try. 

... I would venture to say that Bloodhound represents the best of SOMA bar-life (!).
author: G. J.

description: The atmosphere is... upscale dive? That's a compliment. Good drinks and I've had great experience actually having a bartender acknowledge me or my group and work hard behind the bar. This is rare in SF where most "mixologists" exude the type of smug energy that'd send your business elsewhere. A little too hipster crowd for my style but a good place nonetheless.
author: William S.

description:
Strolled in here several weeks back after a friend's house party nearby.  I guess they'd just opened.  Who knew?  I don't do much drinking on Folsom St.  

It's an interesting space, the hunting theme seemed a tad overdone, but not too annoying.  Personally I'll take the taxidermy at bigfoot over the antlers here, but that's just me.

Lighting was appropriately dim and drinks were appropriately strong.

I'm sure people will shortly say it's full of Marina douchebags,because I really liked it, and while I'm NOT a Marina douchebag, I could sub for one in a pinch.  :)

Any place that I can walk into with one group of friends at 1:15AM and walk out of with a completely different group of new found friends at 2:00AM is my kinda bar.
author: Jay W.

description:
Anywhere that serves me beer in a mason jar is A.O.K with me. A great combination of the SOMA and Mission. This is defiantly a go-to bar if you are looking for a good central spot in the city. 



Good beer in mason jars while playing Deerhunter, that's the life for me.
author: Jes V.

description:
chill bar. within walking distance of one  of my fave restaurants - Bossa Nova.

I don't know how busy this place gets on a Friday night, but it was nice, not packed, easy to stand around chilling without getting bumped.

Ladies bathroom was clogged though, so that shortened our stay.
author: Kym P.

description: This is my neighborhood bar (but it's not in my neighborhood- insert annoyed groan from SOMA residents).  Bloodhound is seriously worth a commute across town.  The best drinks, really nice service and a great crowd.  I always seem to meet  some cool new people here.  Whether you just want a beer or to find your favorite new crafted cocktail Bloodhound won't disappoint.
author: R G.

description:
I was really excited to go to Bloodhound when it first opened because I had previously been to the stale piece of toast that was Cassidy's. I did like their 'Cheers" style four sided bar, but it was mostly filled with German exchange students from the hostel that was around the corner (is that even still there?)

Anyhoo, I came on the second day this place was open. It was crowded and full of people I had never seen in this neighborhood before; which usually means in a few weeks I will be able to walk in on a Thursday night and be able to pick any seat I want and have a very comfortable time without anyone bothering me.

Au contraire, mon frère! I went last night (Friday) and it was still full. Full of bike messengers and hipsters, the quiet and loud, dogs and one couple that was all over each other on the fun swively-wheely chairs.

Sorry - you loose a star for the expensive cocktails. Yes -they're good. But not that good. And I love the beer in a mason jar that gives it the moonshine-in-the-woods feel that punctuates the cabin-in-the-rough decor.

Both times I have had the same bartender. You're awesome.
author: Alicia C.

description:
good dive bar

Buck Hunter with a Recoil (Bulleit, St Germaine, and ginger beer)
author: around town e.

description:
The ambiance is arty hunting shack. The birds stenciled on the ceiling is a nice touch. Good selection of beers on tap, including Old Speckled Hen and Scrimsaw, and served in jelly jars. 

There's a very nice and big pool table in the back with plenty of room to play.

Minus a star for their internet jukebox, because then you're always just one douchebag's dollar's worth of Dave Matthews Band away from running out the front door.
author: Adam Z.

description: I always saw this place, but never went inside. I like the vibe inside. Very speakeasy-esque. Specialty cocktails are good, and it wasn't too crowded when I went.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Bar decorated like a hunting lodge. Crowd depends on the night, but usually very friendly. Service is friendly and price is about average for the city.

Definitely not a fancy place - IMO, almost divey.. Fun, laid back atmosphere and crowd. Friday and Saturday nights are good nights if you actually like a good amount of people. The other nights are hit or miss - if there's a group holding a celebration of sorts, then it'll be crowded but not too crowded. If no group, it'll be fairly quiet with just a handful of friendly locals.
author: Will T.

description:
Holy s**t (am I aloud to say s**t?)

Finally a nice local bar in SOMA.  It kind of reminds me of a Russian Hill bar transplanted to the south of Market.  

Caveat:
This bar could turn into 1 of 2 places.
1) Marina by proxy - a crowd that I'm not looking for.  I could definitely see this place being packed all the time.  Good for Bloodhound, sad for Zak D.
2) SOMA proper - a nice locals bar. No Prada glasses.  Fewer than two Jager Bombs per evening.

I'm actually conflicted writing this post because I'd prefer a more low-key locale, but I'd really like to see Bloodhound succeed.  

See you there tomorrow...and the night after...
author: Zak D.

description:
I met up with a buddy here last night. I dig the "Fox and the Hound" feel of the place, complete with a "Buck Hunter" video game. 

I would've given 4 stars, but they didn't have Effen Black Cherry, which I loooooooove taking chilled shots of, with a lime wedge as a chaser. However, they DO have a crap load of other liquors that you probably won't find elsewhere. Seriously, they had a whole wall of stuff that looked as exotic as a Black person with blue eyes!

FYI- Try the chicharonnes! Very interesting stuff. Per the ingredients list on the bag: A little chili, sugar, salt - in that order- and you got yourself a tasty snack. Soooo Good!!
author: Charles B.

description: I love this place because I can bring my pooch here!  Fun, chill, trendy, cool, hip, maybe a taaaaaaaaaad pretentious, but the bartenders know their stuff.  Love it.  I come here on Sunday afternoons sometimes and just let me very well behaved social butterfly dog work the house while my friends and I shoot pool.  LOVE IT.  (bartenders always offer great tips and things to try if you ask)
author: Sam O.

description:
I have not been to this place in a while and decided to walk in today for happy hour. This place has a chill vibe with pinball machine and pool table for some light crowd interaction. It can get a bit douchey with the financial district folks and what not, but a few of the specialty cocktails makes it all better.
Definitely a place to check out for the older crowd, or anyone for that matter, who wants to avoid the young crowds.
author: Evan K.

description:
+ super friendly bartenders, quick & efficient service, reasonable drinks 

+ cute! love the birds on the ceiling... the vibe. the antler chandelier, the framed hunting themed art, duck hunt(!), the beer served in mason jars! 

+ GREAT jukebox 

+ comfy. we lucked out with claiming the black leather couch-like seats on the side where our pretty big sized group were able to spread out comfortably. 

- no photo booth. that's what takes my bar reviews to 5 stars. it's also why my friend and i took off 30 minutes before closing time to try to make last call at annie's. a photo booth strip to commemorate a saturday night's debauchery is so obviously a necessity. fer reals.
author: Callie K.

description:
Is it right to love a bar for it's ceiling? I don't care for much else, but I damn well love that ceiling with all of its fluttering birds. In fact, I want that on my own ceiling. I want the interior decorator to just turn my white-walled apartment into some wood & warmth styled inn. You can ditch the hipsters tho. 

Beer is served in jam jars (can you really drink out of a jam jar in a ladylike fashion? I don't think I am capable, personally) and at $5 a pop, it's neither overly expensive but certainly not dive bar prices either. But, I get to sit on a couch and stare at that ceiling, so I don't really care. You can have my extra dollar. I love you, ceiling.
author: Catriona C.

description: Had a fantastic time last night! The Recoils were delicious! You can't just have one... The rest of the drinks looked amazing. I want to go back and try them all. The atmosphere was very chill. A perfect place to grab a drink to unwind and just have great time. The Bartenders are friendly, efficient, and really make the effort to take care of everyone while still making delicious drinks that keep everybody coming for more.
author: Marta R.

description: super groovy spot. Not a huge selection of beers, but I'm sure you can find a cocktail you'll like here. Be sure to go across the street and check out the City Beer Store while you're in the 'hood.
author: Kim P.

description:
Showed up on a Friday night after hiking over from AT&T Park. Very nice decor and atmosphere; hits the woodland cabin theme nicely. The bar has wood paneling and it doesn't even look tacky! The beer was quality, the cocktails were well mixed, the leather cushions were ample and comfortable. Good people-watching, too. The French cuisine food truck at Folsom and 7th didn't harsh the experience none, either.

I was with a couple other younger twenty-somethings and we did notice that we were obviously the kids in the room (not that we were treated that way!), but hey, after a couple months in Berkeley it's a nice change of scenery.

And yeah, the ceiling is great!
author: Tim S.

description:
low-lit hunting decor, lounge seating, nice bartenders, and they allow dags (or dogs for you non-brad-pitt-pikey speakers).  what more could you ask for?

i've gotta come back and spend more time here next time i'm in the 'hood (and/or when i get a dag).
author: dan a.

description: Simple and straightforward. It's a dimly lit bar with lots of tables to stand around and a long bar. They had a special drink with bourbon which was a plus. It was a bourbon, canton, sweet and sour and Fever Tree ginger beer. Uber tasty. They make quality drinks and they had a pool table which I didn't partake in but the drinks were good.
author: Hyung L.

description:
Wow, this place oozes cool; it seeps out of the wooden floorboards, the bright green pool tables, the antler chandelier... and behind the massive biker bartender and his glinting array of liquors and liquors and liquors...
Despite the masculine mystique of Bloodhound, I find it quite female friendly. Our beast of a bartender was so sweet, we wanted to try the citron flavored Patron but not as a pure shot and asked if he knew any cocktails that utilized it; he did not but quickly whipped us up some Tequila Sunrise-esque drinks. Delighted we demanded he name the drink and instead of feeling harassed played along with our demands and gave us:
"Sparkling Sunrise". Biker man. "Sparkling Sunrise". LOVED it.
I had a good, chill time at Bloodhound. If you're searching for a resting point in the SOMA, this is it!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Ok, I'm totally expecting my rating to change but I really have to mark this low to start out.  It may not be fair to judge the Bloodhound on Folsom Street Fair Sunday.  I just spent 12 bucks on two drafts and you tell me that you've closed your bathrooms to your PAYING customers?  Christee on Crispix!!! You have an employee stationed by the bathrooms telling people to use the porta potties across the street.  Why not stamp the hands of paying customers and check as they ask to use the loo? 

Hopefully I'll be back and be able to rate this as others have.
author: Kevin-John B.

description: Great place to come hangout with some friends on the weekend.
author: Anthony V.

description:
We have a winner. First off, its half a block from my house. Now that may not seem all that to you, but if you are me, or you hang out at my house (you should be so lucky!) then its kind of a big deal. Another huge benefit is not having to walk down 6th street towards market like I would to go to Matador.

The drinks are strong. The MBGITW had a Bloodhound No. 1. A twist on a greyhound with the addition of Campari. Fun and drinkable. I tried the Ricky Ricardo, because I love Lucy, and I was in the mood for tequila. After that and a pint of Old Speckled Hen, I was certainly loopy. The intoxicating vapor of freshly butchered pig smoke didn't help either.

Great decor, quite an upgrade from Cassidy's. The interior looked very, um, Portland, but in a good way. Antler chandelier,  a flock of birds painted on the ceiling. But The place also has the solid touches of a good bar. A pool table in the back, a shooting game, a nice long bar that was accessible even during a crowded event, good lighting. I love hunting lodges and the whole gentleman's retreat look, so i found Bloodhound very comfortable. I'll be back here regularly.

The only problem I see is getting blackout drunk here while doing my laundry across the street at Brainwash and forgetting all of my clothes or stumbling back and heckling amateur comedy night (god please spare me my dignity).
author: Zac H.

description:
Bloodhound?  More like spacious yet cozy wood cabin lodge.  Although I did see a dog inside the bar for whatever that's worth. 

A bit rustic, with rich brown tones.  Large leather couches, pool table in the back, not overly crowded.   Super friendly bartenders.  Good crowd. The music isn't too loud so you're not yelling at each other.  

If you look up, you see doves painted on the ceiling.  I got the sense that if I were a German yodeler, this would be the place where I would pound some beer and do a series of flick kicks.  But as fate would have it, I do not yodel, nor am I not German, but the idea does sound intriguing.   

Ah-de-lay-hee-who!!!
author: Soo Jin K.

description:
5 stars. I'll tell you why:

* Old Speckled Hen. Best beer I've had in a long time. I hesitate to say ever, but damn it's sweet.

* Big Buck Hunter. Awesome video game when you're drinking. Fits the decor really well.

* Decor. Speaking of which, it looks like if Tahoe and Aspen could somehow grow genitalia, boink, and sprout a child, you'd have Bloodhound.

* The Bar. Drinks are well poured. Beer is well chosen. A lot of good ones besides the Hen.

* Pool Table. Every bar should have at least one table. Seriously. No, seriously. I'm looking at you Chieftan.
author: Josh B.

description: Delicious cocktails with interesting flavour profiles.  Dogs are welcome, it has a pool table, and the patrons are friendly.  It is a neighbourhood bar.  Plus, the decor is interesting.  Barn meets steampunk?  We had no problem getting service but we were there early evening.
author: Rosanne W.

description: I was one of the friends that came with Jennifer L. below. Luckily for me, I was the only one not overdressed so I felt pretty normal. But our group definitely stood out. I liked the bar. I'd go back if I was a bro or in my mid to late 20s or early 30s with a big group of friends to chillax. Currently, I am not interested in getting hit on by creepy older men with receding hairlines. Maybe next time Bloodhound.
author: Ivy C.

description: This is my new favorite place for drinks in SF.  The decor is awesome (cool birds on the ceiling? check!), the mason jars add a wonderful touch, and the drink list is creative and delicious.  Great vibe, perfect ratio of seats/standing spaces, good people, good volume level - all in all, perfect spot for late night drinks after work.
author: Michelle T.

description:
So I travel a lot for work, like if I was in the witness relocation program. Any given week could be in South America, Asia or Oklahoma or creating mayhem back home in San Francisco. This bar is rocking, let me go ahead and break it down for you:

- Always a cool crowd of easy to talk to people
- The partners/bartenders remember your name and bring a drink pretty quickly
- Friendly furry dogs roaming about
- Free Internet access. Yes its at a bar, but man isnt always better to finish that last hour of work at a bar as opposed to your cubicle or at home watching another Law and Order SVU?
- Good strong drinks
- A pool table and a hunting game, I never play the hunting game all that often, but man it is the best when your pretty drunk
- Comfortable sofa's and chairs that spin around, you need to spin around in them
- Free BBQ from time to time on Saturdays
author: Fabian O.

description:
This place is awesome. It's a good sized space with a great casual-yet-well-thought-out style. The bartender (and co-owner) is helpful, friendly, and know his sh*t. Good beers on tap and a wide selection of bourbons makes for a great menu. Overall cool place yet still comfortable.

Also, be sure to try the "whisky sticks" which are super-tasty meat snacks from Fatted Calf. A brilliant addition to the bar! I was there last night (Wednesday) and it had a solid crowd but was not crowded--I could still get a seat. It gets busy on the weekends for sure.
author: Benjamin G.

description: I am very happy that Bloodhound is my neighborhood bar. Even if I had other choices that were walking distance from my loft, I would still choose Bloodhound. Why? Because they have the best bourbon, rye, whisky selection. The owner is often there and is quite the polite and knowledgeable owner. And he's friends with Fatted Calf & 4505 Meats which means I automatically respect the establishment! And their cocktails are great. And I can get my doggie fix because they allow guests to bring in their dogs when it's not too busy. :-)  As a dog-lover I approve.
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description: Even for a Wednesday night, Bloodhound is hopping. The hunter's lodge ambience is just enough to be charming without being overwhelming. Impressive variety of alcohol. The service was quick and the drinks are served in chunky mason jars - a cute touch. Added bonus, dogs are welcome!!
author: Jules B.

description: This place is solid. Good atmosphere, wide range of (strong and delicious) drinks, takes credit cards and has tables and couches to kick back and enjoy whatever beverage you are sipping on. AND the prices are reasonable. Went to a happy hour here a few weeks back with some friends and would be inclined to go again, for sure. If this were my neighborhood, this would probably be my bar. I like it.
author: Shanna T.

description: I liked this place. It was pretty crowded when I was there but the drinks were yummy and the decor was impressive. I love all these old timey woody bars that seem to be in fashion right now. My kind of place.
author: Turi F.

description:
Good beer list.  Pretty good cocktails depending on the bartender.  Good atmosphere.  Fun crowd.  Like the lodge look but wish they went a bit further with the kitch.

Good Bar all around.
author: Doreen D.

description:
Cool and somewhat unusual (for SF) hunting-lodge-ish sort of vibe, with a big antler chandelier, wood paneling, and a bunch of big comfy dark leather chairs & couches.  They've also got Big Buck Hunter and a pool table.

The booze selection is quite good - a reasonable selection of scotch, and a good selection of bourbon, rum, tequila, etc.  Cocktails are well-made, and the bar tenders are friendly and have a lot of character.  They fit the place well.  Reasonable beer selection on tap & bottle as well, and they serve them in mason jars.  Fun.

The place is pretty goodly sized, giving you lots of space to get your drink on.
author: Don H.

description:
opens "friday", but i walked in last night and it was as open as it could be; and pretty crowded. I was a pretty big fan of cassidy's in terms of a local bar. 5 bucks for a beer (in a nifty mason jar) was a dollar more than i was hoping to pay (especially when i can walk across the street and get a 5 dollar beer from the city beer store that amazingly obscure and delicious), but owell.  beer list is just OK in my opinion, but again i'm biased based on what you can get next door. bar looked fully stocked though.

that said, it is really nice inside. i dig the lighting. i thought the mirrors up top where a little out of place compared to the rest of the rustic theme, but  all in all its very well put together. bathroom was very standard, and thus  lame in comparison to the rest of the bar, but it is a bathroom i guess. 

probably the best part was the crowd, which was pretty mixed. better than the typical soma place, so hopefully that sticks around.

all in all, honestly it was the big buck hunter that made the place for me. i walked in really hoping for a foosball table, but being from ohio i was pretty much sold when i saw big buck hunter. not to mention last night it was free to play. i'm guessing its because they are just opening. or maybe it was a fluke. but i'm praying that it will just remain free all the time. then its 5 stars from me.
author: justen e.

description:
This bar reminds me of an upscale Lake Tahoe establishment that is content with keeping business/hardworking folks in and crazy mofoes from the 6th/Mission area out. No problem with me. Im with it. I like to enjoy my drinks guns and knife wielding peckerhead free anyways.

Great selection of bottles and beer. The bartenders are really friendly and knowledgeable about all-around drinks. If not, they're more than willing to learn from ya and still charge ya the minimum. I dont come here on a regular basis but when I do, make sure you get a piece of the pool table at least once, have a decent game to watch on the TV and play at least 5 bucks worth of BuckHunter Pro. 

Spacious, lodgy feeling and good enough to get your pre-drink on before the next move. Yeeee
author: Nick V.

description:
I don't know if it was a change in ownership orjust a remodel but the metamorphasis from cassidy's into the bloodhound is the best thing to happen to this neighborhood since the City Beer store.  

HUGE improvement - kitchy, fun, different, and already too popular, but nevertheless.   I double dig dig it.
author: Rick R.

description: Came here as my first stop during SF Beer week.  The beer selection was terrific, and to top it off there was a lady was there selling some of the best meat balls I've ever had.  Bar tender was friendly, and this is good place to go grab a good beer.
author: Bill W.

description: for a wed night, this place was poppin'!  the drinks here are really tasty, but the place kinda smells.
author: Helen T.

description:
this place was crowded on a friday night!  i felt like i hadnt been out in forever or maybe i hadnt been out in a place that crowded in forever.  reminded me a bit of rickhouse

the drinks are delicious!  i had a few too many Recoils here.
author: claudia y.

description:
let me break it down for ya:

1) roomy with lots of space to mingle and cool couches to chill out. 
2) Well made cocktails, but they also have lovely Belgian beers on tap. the prices are ok, but the selection needs to improve. 
3) No nibbles, but they allow delivery or pop next store to TripTych for their tartar and lam dishes. oh ya, they deliver in style! 
4) Good location as you can start at Beer Store and then pop over to Bloodhound. 

Ok, that about covers it, so head on over and enjoy
author: Jai D.

description:
I support Bloodhound.

nice staff. . . good drinks.  well done interior.  beats Cassidy's.
author: Leia K.

description: I went to this place for the first time a few days ago.  I had no idea what to expect and then was pleasantly surprised because it was awesome.  I'm a total girlie girl, but I loved the rough, hipster, hunting lodge feel.  The crowd was casual, but no one batted an eye at the fact that I was pretty dressed up.  The bartenders took really good care of us and I would totally go back.
author: Anne R.

description: I'm not really a dive bar kind of gal (in part because they all seem to have a faint or strong urine odor), but this one is not too bad.  We went here mainly to have Pizza Hacker pizza and find a place to sit and have some drinks.  If you can get a comfy seat near the front, it's not too bad.
author: B. Y.

description:
fun cocktails, old school music, laid back vibe, not a ton of youngins. i like. 
spaghetti western = tasty and potent.
author: Karena Q.

description: Bloodhound is lively for a Wednesday night. There's free wi-fi, a pool table and a tv (not currently on though.) the recoil makes you do just that. Love the decor, painted birds, filament bulbs hanging over the bar and tables and the drinks in mason jars are fun. Great place to hang with with friends.
author: Shelly W.

description:
The guys from Double Dutch and Ambassador do it all over again!  In a totally new fashion they've managed to one-up the dive bar with an urban lounge feel that doesn't get ahead of itself and keeps it real with a rustic theme.  Only these guys could put together a urban/modern bar using construction materials that would build a Montana hunting lodge. (That raw wood panneling was stripped from a 120 y.o. barn, so awesome I had to ask). 

A great bar, great staff and a great feel.  The relaxed vibe and the drink selection had me coming back but the addition of a Pool Table and Big Buck Hunter will make it my home away. 

And finally, there is a great place to go thats walking distance from Slims.
author: Josh L.

description: Great bar. Awesome beer selection great staff. Awesome place to bring the dog and hang out.
author: Simon B.

description: Buckhunter, Almanac on tap, and great drinks such as the Recoil.  Need I say more?  Oh, yes you say?  Ok, 4505 Chicharrones for sale.
author: Danny M.

description:
Bloodhound is a classy, yet laid-back bar great for grabbing some drinks after work. Even when it's crowded, it's not overly uncomfortable. 

The TV's are kept on sports, and dogs are allowed inside. 

Prices are pretty standard, and pretty well made too! Good beer selection, all drafts are served in Mason Jars. 

Definitely a place to check out for yourself.
author: claire s.

description: This place is usually over packed with alcoholists who are drinking from jars which might look classy for the first time but in overall just an addition for the extreme cheap atmosphere. If you like sedated people around you exhaling partially processed terrible alcohol smell from every possible direction while you can't really move or stay in position without being hit by someone who is just loosing control over their basic motoric system, then this place is for you, otherwise think twice before enter. If you're forced to go there, make sure you wear something really cheap or disposable outfit to fit in.
author: Tamas K.

description:
Went there last night for drinks, it was really great! Drinks were potent but very tasty.

Get the Bloodhound drink. I definitely recommend it because they use fresh squeezed grapefruit juice.
author: Tien H.

description:
Five stars because the place does better-than-fine with a basic theme, and the bartenders are good people.  They're not trying to be Bourbon & Branch, Alembic, Nihon, etc.--just a casual place with a sense of personal style.  

And that works, because what you *don't* have here is what you have in all those other places:  childish hipsters, attitudes, aggressive professionals, and people trying to up their social IQ by sipping at a "whiskey bar," etc..  

I've got nothing against those other places, but some nights the crowds at those bars are more than anyone wants to handle.  And, most often, you have to go to those bars with a group, or at a least a friend, so you can muscle some space at the bar, get a table, and so on.

Bloodhound--don't have to worry about all that.  Some nights it gets packed with industry happy hours (tech, arts, film, more), but on most nights you can find a place, even if alone, and talk to the owners and bartenders--all of whom know something about what they're serving you.  

It works as a space, place and bar.  And, these guys just bought the old Transfer @ 14th and Church, and are opening up another bar (with different name, of course).
author: King E.

description: Friend stumbled upon this spot and she highly suggested going back so we did one Friday night. I fell in love right away. Love the ambiance and the mason jar cocktails. Looking forward to going back again and again.
author: Keegan M.

description:
Welp, I drug Mr H & one of his friends there the other night, and it's now their new go-to bar to play pool. 

True, there are sometimes some DBs & DBettes cluttering up the joint, but overall, it's a very chill lil spot. If the sound of popping collars is not more cowbell to your ears, skip Thursdays.

The mustachioed midweek 'tender (my impression is that he's the owner, could be wrong) is very cool & seems to always have a good mix on his iPod or whatever the juke overrides.

They've got some compelling drink specials (one of which has become my at-home cocktail of choice), a well-stocked bar (sip a shot of the Zaya, neat - you'll be glad you did), and Mr H gave a thumbs-up to Mendo county beer on tap.

Solid neighborhood joint.
author: Beverage Appreciato R.

description: Best Old Fashioned I've ever had. Also: Beer selection exceeds requirements/expectations. Staff keeps potentially d-bag crowd on their best behavior.
author: Emerson B.

description:
If you could only see what this place looked like before the face-lift, which is why I love and appreciate my neighborhood Bloodhound that much more. This is one SOMA rathole turned uptown saloon. where Dorothy would kick up her ruby red heels while sipping on a Dark-&-Stormy. Besides the handsome atmosphere, the selection behind the bar is also worth taking advantage of. Unless you really must order your default drink of choice, then I recommend going the adventurous route. at least for your first one. Most of these bartenders know what they're doing and will happily make you an exquisite libation upon request, or recommend a unique beer on tap. given an undemanding crowd- duh.

And their ipod and/or jukebox selection rocks. Whichever one they've got playing, I'm always loving what I'm hearing when I'm here. ..aand on some [Thurs-Sat] nights, there might even be a cartfull of bacon-wrapped hotdogs right outside. You can't ask for much more sensory goodness from a down-to-earth SOMA bar..
author: eVa J.

description: Cold beer in a mason jar, blackbirds airbrushed on the ceilings, antique-style light fixtures, cool crowd, good music and chill bartenders....ahhh....
author: Beth M.

description: I live in da hood.  I took a date here once.  She was lame, but this place, rocks!  Pool table, comfy couches, nice bar, wood paneling and a great arty ceiling of flying birds.  I feel like I should have brought my 12 gauge.  To shoot my date, that is;)  haha. Advise?  Get a greyhound over their bloodhound, it tastes much better...
author: Vinh N.

description: I usually get freaked out when I see a stuffed animal bust on the wall... but for some reason it works here.  Seems like a upscale place at first glance, and then you see the moosehorn chandelier and realize it's more of a homey dive bar.
author: Brian A.

description: In kind of a random spot but the decorations are awesome. There's a pool table and they have a lot of random yet wonderful beers. The service was good.
author: M S.

description: came here on a sunday night of a long weekend so it wasn't busy at all. the ambiance is really nice with a very rustic vibe complete with a deer hunting arcade game towards the back. there's a pool table, a good amount of seating on stools around high tables, and a nice, clean bathroom. i loved the bartenders here - so sweet, genuine and down to earth. shoutout to rudy the bartender for looking out and keeping our water glasses filled without us having to ask as we were sobering up at the end of the night. drinks, except one, are all whiskey and bourbon based and VERY strong!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I hadn't heard of this bar until a friend and I walked past and decided to stop in for a happy hour libation. i was instantly impressed. great decor, fun crowd and an impressive selection of cocktails and beers (in mason jars, how cute)
they have a $5 deal for any cocktail made with hangar one. i recommend their signature cocktail: hangar, campari and grapefruit. 

i'll be back fo sho.
author: Amanda B.

description:
I really like the feel of this place. I love the mason jars, the dead animals and the alcohol selection. Furthermore, the first time I was here there was a super nice bartender and friendly people at the next table. 

However, this review is reflective of a crappy experience I had here Monday night with a bartender I will refer to herein as "Little John" because of his resemblance to said Robin Hood character. I came in there with a middle aged woman, a family friend of my parents' from out of town for an after dinner cocktail. We were slightly indecisive at first which annoyed Little John but we finally ordered our simple glasses of booze and he quickly made them and plopped them in front of us and then with a look of pure contempt asked us if we wanted to start a tab, to which we replied in the affirmative. Now I'm not sure what exactly this man didn't like about us but he was clearly unwelcoming. When he poured some fancy brownish cocktail for the guy next to me I (out of my love of weird herbs and bitters in drinks) curiously asked what it was three times; the first two times he pretended not to hear me and ignored me and the third time he glared at me and said snobbily, "a Fernet cocktail". Of course I nodded to this and thought, "whatever the fuck THAT is... thanks for the explanation you condescending bastard". 
We slowly and slightly uncomfortably sipped our drinks and when we were done and walking out we heard a very insincere, "Have a good night, ladies!" come from behind the bar. 
Dear Little John-
I'm very sorry that a) my guest and I didn't meet your culturally fascist expectations of customers for asking about an interesting looking drink and b) I brought someone who could very well be a suburban mom-type into your awesomely hip bar. 
Get over yourself!
I hate to say it but I'm assuming the reason I had a pleasant experience here the first time is because my drinking partner that night happened to be in her late twenties and covered in tattoos.
author: Allie S.

description:
I liked this bar. It was spacious and had a good atmosphere. The crowd was cool & the bartenders were awesome. Has a pool table for entertainment as well.

One of the few bars in SOMA that I could see myself frequenting.
author: linda t.

description: the deer hunter's bar?...styling and decor that of a tahoe cabin....wilderness and wooden...birds above and antlers hung...quite the wretched stench of stale beers pungent...a full bar and mason jar contained beers served....fair pricing of $five beers and roughly $ten well...decent spacing for drinks and conversations....just turned off by stale stench lingering....
author: Hen A.

description:
Huge fan of Bloodhound, first went for a friend's birthday, then decided to have my birthday there. I emailed them a month in advanced and asked if they could reserve two table for my party (they said no problem & there was no charge!).

Has the feel of a very upscale dive bar, but isn't divey at all...hard to explain. There is an antler chandelier on the ceiling and some birds too. They also play some pretty good music, even though I do not remember what they played.

They have a little lounge area in the front. It doesn't get overly packed and the crowd is pretty mixed. We had the first table reserved, so my party took over that whole area, everyone had a great time. I brought light-up ice cubes, and they were a big hit!

Love Bloodhound, just wish I lived a little closer, will definitely be back soon!
author: Elaine S.

description:
I've already been here twice since the opening this past Thursday. It's definitely a nice addition to the Folsom Street bars, which tend to be a little seedy. I like the saddle ranch/hunting vibe to the place. 

Uncertain how to interpret the crowd...there were a lot of "older" people there last night, but a younger crowd on Thursday...
author: Misha F.

description:
I sat in the front corner last night on the big wraparound couch and was totally into the atmosphere here. Good lighting/color/texture. Understated and comfortable. 

The antler chandelier over the pool table is definitely the crowning aesthetic jewel of this bar and I hope that the owners continue to add more elements like that to the space.

Eaaaaassssy parking and right up the street from Basil, if you are on the hunt for some good food, too.
author: Joanna R.

description:
I went here on Saturday for the first time after reading about it in Daily Candy weeks ago. I really liked this place. The decor (except for the animal heads, sorry, not my thing) was great. It is divey, but cleaner than a regular dive. They serve the smaller beers in ball jars, that's quite undivey and trendy these days.
I definitely was not a fan of the neighborhood, but I would recommend this bar to friends and go back myself...
author: Shelley M.

description:
Wow. They really spruced this joint up. 

I came to this location this past summer during a rowdy day party. The bar was a dive, kinda shady, kinda fun. yeah, one of those. 

Bloodhound is completely transformed from the previous bar. The bar is really pretty and there is a good mix of people. It was someones birthday and they even offered cake! What bliss! The drinks were strong, but kind of pricey-weak sauce. All in all, i really like this bar.
author: Bobby P.

description: After departing the snooty City Beer Store & Tasting Bar ( see my review) we Yelped up this gem of a neighborhood bar. Great beers served cold in Mason jars, dogs roaming the area (including ours) and a great mix of people. Yes, the decor is awesome. Yes, the hunting video game is fun. Yes, the bartender was great! We will be back!
author: Scott A.

description:
super delicious hot buttered rum that tastes like candy ! i love the decent wide spaces on a weeknight. their recoil cocktail (bourbon, st. germain, ginger beer and lime) was a refreshing limeade with a gingery bite,

though i was eyeing the jar of those deeeeeelicious 4505 chicharrones, i resisted the urge because i knew i'd be able to eat the whole jar.

turns out someone else thought they could do the same and bought the entire jar's contents before leaving!

damn
author: kristin e.

description: It's hard for people to take a good hard look at themselves and own their shit, good or bad.  The vodka sodas I had here pushed me over the edge of the cliff and straight down into PENISFAIL VALLEY, and as much as I want to blame Bloodhound for not being like a vast majority of other bars in San Francisco that make ridiculously weak mixed drinks...I can't.  I have no one to blame but myself.  No excuses and no calling "do over!"  I'm the lush that chugged those drinks down to end a night of already ridiculous drinking and loved every last drop.
author: Luis M.

description:
This is a huntin, and yes I said huntin lodge. I am from Texas, what do you want? 

Ok, so this place is like every hunt lodge in the south, minus the games and tables in the back. Greet woven faux leather couches that you can sprawl out on. I was there under odd circumstances, however they pour a mighty stiff drink. I would go back, yet I am not sure how well the dead carcass motif will go over w/ the hipsters and SOMA people. It is an odd mix of people to be honest, yet this is the city, so anything goes.
author: Nicole F.

description:
Its just one place after another opening up in my hood...love it!  Cant say how relieved I am that the shit hole of a bar Cassidy's is gone.  Now I should say that I have nothing against dirty dive bars, as a matter of fact I love them, but Cassidys was the pits.  Anyway, out with the old and in with the new!

Bloodhound has an excellent diversity of cocktail and beer selection.  Although not as extensive as other places maybe, it covers pretty much everything you want.  Also, I highly recommend ordering a greyhound here....very fresh grapefruit...yum!   I can drink those things all night long.  I lived in Florida for 17 years with 4 different kinds of cirtus trees in my back yard, so when i tell you citrus is good, listen to me!

The newly designed interior is very well done, with perfect lighting (a pet peeve of mine), a really cool but not cheesy hunting lodge motif, and plenty of space, except at the single pool table.  

I dont think I'll be going there on weekends too much since I live a block away and the crowd can get a bit Marina-ey (go away pink popped collars and obnoxious factory-produced blond bitches!).  Other than a few exceptions, its usually a very nicely balanced diversity of people, which is nice to see.  

Oh, and the bartender with the handlebar stache (who i think is an owner) can make a mean cocktail.  Ask him to make you a custom one if its not too busy, you wont be disappointed!  Tip well too!
author: Mike H.

description:
A very heartfelt 5 stars for Bloodhound!  

Yes, the decor and layout is cool and roomy.  And the place does have a refreshing new-car smell about it.  Also, beer in mason jars speaks to this Southerner's down home roots.  But the service absolutely clenched my love of this place.  

The fiance and I stroll in around 9:15 on a Saturday.  Definitely not crowded yet, but we notice that 3 different tables have reserved signs on them.  We chill at one of the tables for a bit, knowing full well we'll need to get up when the party at hand arrives (no biggie, it IS Saturday, and people have birthdays to celebrate).  They do arrive, and one of the managers comes over to shoo us away...in the most polite, apologetic manner in the world.  Truly, the guy's apology was so sincere, I was a hair shy of giving him a hug and telling him everything would be ok.  

We relocate to a corner of the bar, and order another beer.  One of the other bar owners attends to our order, and insists that it's on the house for us having to relocate from the reserved table.  Incredible!  The place eventually gets packed, and each bartender continues to check up on us regularly, including refilling water glasses without being asked.  Oh, and the staff was a-ok with one of their regulars bringing his dog in.  Just another random little touch to indicate the chill yet attentive vibe of Bloodhound.

Great beer selection, but I have to say that the Red Rocket is pretty funky ("Tyler no likey").  Once we switched up our selection, all was right with the world.

Go and enjoy!
author: Deidre B.

description: I like this bar its chill, drinks are cheap, interesting decor, I can chat and just chill!
author: Rhea F.

description: I thought about jacking the antler chandelier but figured, one: it would require some technical thought much too serious in such a drunken state, and two: i would love to be allowed back again for endless free pretzels, beer in jars, and jolly bartenders with some of the best beards this city has seen. bloodhound has a great atmosphere, great beers, and a great big painting of an upright himalayan brown bear. excellent.
author: Raquel C.

description:
This is close to becoming one of my favorite bars. I would give it 4 1/2 stars if I could. I am not a mixed drink kind of lady, but they have some amazing cocktails. If you think one on the menu looks good, but you're not sure about one ingredient, voila! The bartender makes you something new and creative! They have great beers, I love the vibe of the place, and it was a bunch of really good looking people right around my age. It seems like a really great place to go with some single ladies because there were a ton of guys there, the bar staff was all male, and very cute (especially boy with the beard and flannel :), and every time a group of girls sat still, they were flocked by hungry, well-dressed men.  It was quite a spectacle to observe.
I drank the Finley, which is gin, dry and sweet vermouth, and a touch of ginger beer. I also had a Monte Carlo, which involved bourbon and deliciousness (something like a Manhattan), and I had sips of pretty much everything else on the menu. If I had stayed out later I would have gotten an Old Speckled Hen. They also have some crazy strong beers, and $3 cans of Olympia and High Life. This bar is awesome and worth getting out of my neighborhood for. I like them so much I left my debit card there last night. Curse those cocktails!
author: Merrilee T.

description:
Great bar.   This is a great addition to SOMA.  First impression is that it is a Marina bar transplant but upon further inspection you realize its good ol' SOMA with just a bit of a face lift.  The type of crowd shifts heavily depending on when you go but there's always good people watching. 

+
Dogs are allowed
Good beer selection.  Old Speckled Hen is great.
Bartender has a sweet stache, and not adverse to chatter
Nice interior.  Modern lodge.
Buckhunter and a sweet pool table

-
Crowd is a bit lame sometimes
Cocktails didn't seem too great
author: Jared K.

description: Alright, I ended up at bloodhound a couple times last week when the crowd wasn't as douchie as my previous experiences, and I was able to better appreciate the solid (but not superior) cocktails, rustic charm and Old Speckled Hen in a mason jar.  Not a bar I would go out of my way to reach, but I will no longer cringe when invited there for birthday parties.
author: Quinn S.

description: The atmosphere in here was great. Drinks are good and strong, bartender does a great pour. They have a pool table (a plus in my book!) You can tell it is a local bar, people who work in the area go here after their shifts but all are welcomed and pretty friendly. There is a guy outside who makes pizza we were told we had to try it, maybe next time it looked great.
author: X X.

description:
quite impressed with this bar. the place has a friendly atmosphere and has great imported beer. they serve almost all the drinks in these jars which is unique but i hope its not less than a regular pint of beer. the interesting thing is that they allow dogs so watch out under you because you don't wanna be kicking someone's dog. there could be a few more seats around as it a lot of people can come in and if u're unlucky u will end up standing all night.

on some nights, the chairman bao food truck will be outside and so you can get some great food to go with a great drink
author: edward k.

description:
I dig it.

Bloodhound has brought a bit of class to the neighborhood. It's got a funky feel to it, but nice and clean. The pool table is the most expensive I've seen @ $1.00 / game, but if they keep it maintained and nice cues as a result, then I'm ok with it...all part of the price of admission to maintain the higher-end atmosphere. I'm tight with the owner's of Julie's down the street, but they just wouldn't listen to me and put in a pool table or two...However, they need to PUT UP A CHALKBOARD so those of us who want to play can get down to it. 

The jukebox is all over the map, but I'm happy to see The Pixies in there along with the classic rock and hip hop. I think they made it overly diverse on purpose until they feel out their demographic a bit better.

It will be interesting to see how the new place affects the feel of the area. I'm with Zak: hopefully it won't be a massive Marina magnet. In any case, definitely a great addition to Folsom!

Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Erich N.

description: Great little neighborhood bar - not really crowded and a large bar. Would definitely come back here! Oh and the bartender had a heavy hand. I ordered a vodka soda and I think it was all vodka :)
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Well duh.  These guys are the best and they did a damn good job on the place.  Everyone that works here is friendly.  Bartenders, owners and bouncers.  My review of Cassidy's?  Horrible.  Bloodhound?  GREAT!

Friends to the end.  Especially when they brought a great bar to the neighborhood.  I've seen about a hundred old friends here since they've opened.  I've also met a lot of folks from the hood who are really nice and glad to have a quality spot to have some drinks.

Great jukebox also!
author: Erin D.

description:
Very cool bartender the Saturday night we were there and an open pool table.   
Cool place, I'll definitely go back.

Love the bartender with the handle bar mustache!! 
Love this place!
author: Deb S.

description: Overall a pretty cool hangout. There were some vibes of "trying too hard" or having a manufactured bohemian vibe, but the drinks were stiff (not good tasting), and the prices were fair. I enjoyed the black bird stencils on the ceiling, and the bartender was friendly. Not in the most ideal location for return visits, but this area of Soma is almost pub crawl worthy with City Beer, Terroir, and Brainwash across the street. Granted, that would be a pretty random and expensive pub crawl, hehe.
author: Melody H.

description: $9 New Manhattan was tasty. Recoil was a bit too sour for my tastes. I liked drinks being served in mason jars and being reasonably strong. Comfy couches. Friendly people.
author: Kimberley D.

description: Loved the space and i finally found a bar chill enough to have a pool table! Busy weekends and quite the crowd and waiting for drinks always dampers the evening.
author: Karisa C.

description: This place is good.  It's not a dive and I am not going to categorize the decor.  Drinks are good, don't care that they don't serve food, bring your own in.  Good selection of quality booze and Saison du Pont on tap. I felt comfy, it was early, I'm not one for late drinking.  The bartender was good too.
author: Erin M.

description:
Friendly atmosphere, great bartenders, superb cocktails.  

California lodge dolled up with San Francisco flair, Bloodhound is delicately rustic.  Akin to The Page in attitude, crowd, and presence of a pool table, but with more leg room and a place to set your coat and hat.
author: Heather H.

description:
Bloodhound could easily be missed as you walk down Folsom. Although it has large windows and a substancial sign it doesn't immediately jump out as 'the place to go' - so it was most fortunate that I was invited to the Happy Hour there.

I was a little intimidated at first by the sudden darkness as I went in but as my eyes adjusted to the room I suddenly felt intrigued. This was not the Dive bar I had expected at all.

 A beautiful solid bar ran down the right hand side of the room with stools at just the right hight for the various patrons to sit on and then rich dark brown wall seats on the left with what could only be described as rather 'fun' looking low recliners which were on wheels. The ceiling immediately caught my eyes with the shadows of birds circling overhead. Even the artwork had been carefully considered and raised an eyebrow with its diversity and tongue in cheek nature.

What really excited me though was the treasures that lay at the back of the bar. A fine pool table, begging to be played, a juke box with an incredibly diverse range of music and a 'Big Buck Hunter' game as well.

A bar is not made a decent bar by its decor though.

Luckily this one has just used the interiour to compliment 'its offer' - which is a wide range of spirits, some well thought out wines (not a huge selection - but well chosen) and a cocktail list which is best described as leathally excellent.

My favourite cocktail so far is the Ward 8 - which is made with excellent precision and flair by each of the bar tenders I have so far met. While if you are feeling like something without alcohol they can with equal dilligence whip up a fruity little number which will refresh and revitalise immediately.

The staff here are friendly and patient. Quick and skilled.

The space is large enough for a group of people to go drinking together although I would really not recommend having your gathering next to the pool table - unless you like being poked and hit with the pool que. :)

This is the place to go if you want a stress free drink with friends - the only bad thing to say about it? Those cocktails are far too easy to drink, the bar tenders far too good at making them quickly and the end result is you may go home significantly poorer.... ;)
author: Lulu R.

description: Loved what they did with this place.  The decor is is really cool and cozy.  We felt like we were in Tahoe or Colorado or something.  Great bartenders as well.  I would definitely come back for after work drinks or even after dinner in the Mission.  Good spot for when I am in the neighborhood
author: Kirsten M.

description:
I've been here several times now and I see a trend emerging, which leads me to drop a star back. For two reasons.  

One - Your cocktail experience will hinge entirely on which bartender makes your drink.  If you get the skinny shaved head guy, order a beer instead.  He is way too busy chatting up the women at the bar, and way too focused on checking his phone and texting to see what he's putting into the shaker and into your glass.  If you get the portly red headed gentleman - where are you?? - order down the list, one of each, and have a ball. 

Two - The other current feature of this place that warrants a dropped star is, unfortunately, the people.  Rotating mix of marina white chicks - "ooh oooh, let's go check out the guys in SOMA! ...  Yeah, let's totally do it, rawr!!", skin-tight flannel plaid shirt bicycle people talking loud to ensure they get noticed, hyper professional skinny cougar types with way too much lipstick, and some after work crowd taking group photos they'll probably immediately post on their "about us" page on their website.  So what is my problem with these people?  It's certainly not their dress or make-up.    My look no doubt will offend some hyperbolic critic too.  I get it.  So what's my beef??  In short, the vanity.  It's that the people here each seem to be here for a distinct and instrumental purpose.  No one in the room seems to be enjoying someone else's company or just themselves being there.  Instead, it's like they're there strictly *for something* - to find a loud talking skin-tight flannel shirt bicycle boy to take home, or to show their co-workers how "chill" they can be, or just to sit and enjoy their spectacular selves no matter who they're talking to.  If you're thinking... "hello, this is almost every bar in this city" I'd say you are mostly right.  but i think it's still useful to know which ones tend to be this way and which ones don't.  And my previous review failed to mention this about this place.
author: Nikki F.

description: Reviewing bars is such a tricky beast but I'm going to put it right out there that Bloodhound deserves a serious thumbs up. They did an absolutely incredible job on the decor. I get so tired of the same minimalist concrete and wood combo at every other bar in the city. It was refreshing to find a rustic but cozy interior to Bloodhound, almost like you're at a ski lodge but with well-dressed pretty people ready for a night out on the town. You can chill here with your friends or you can put your game face on and get in on the action. Either way, you're going to have a good time. The beers on tap are $5 and the cocktails are different, in a good way. Sit, stand, mingle, or wallflower. This place offers something for everyone.
author: Susan L.

description:
a korean lawyer lady moved into this nieghborhood so we came out to see her drunk ass here one night. its a rare occasion this ladys drunk so i try to make it out each and everytime. i like it whens shes drunk. she makes me smile. she hilarious!!! like me when im drunk, minus the stripping and swearing and self inflicted injuries.

they have a good selection of drinks and the folks working the bar were on point with the drinks. i loved the mason jars. sure its kitchy, but im a southern boy at heart i guess. i love shooting guns and drinking beer. i USED to jump cars on the balboa hill, but that was years ago when there was no stop sign at the bottom of the hill.....

i like the look of this place, i get a very cabin in the woods feel here. not sure if the hunting game is supposed to be ironic, but me being the excellent shot with a scatter gun and the finace, having shot a 30 ought 8 for the first time before she could stay out till dark *shes from the south... no explanation needed right?* we were right up in that. apparently, im a murdering maniac. doe, buck, turkey, innocent bystander standing next to the game... youre all getting shot.

i digress... yeah, so this place is comfortable enough. theres loungy couches to one side and a long bar on the other. 

oh... but be warned.... apparently i wasnt paying attention to EXACTLY where i was.

*story time*

so after meeting up with drunk korean lawyer and fairly equally drunk messican and meeting the awesome couple maya and jaime and of course, after a couple beers, i walk outside to smoke. im standing in front of the large window of bloodhound and these two guys walking by keep staring at me. im thinking to myself, forget it. youre too old for this kind of crap. youre engaged for god sakes..

i go back inside. after a drink and some laughs, i go outside for another smoke. wtf!?!?!? a group of guys give me the stink eye while walking by. at this point im pretty intoxicated and feeling about two feet taller than i am and im thinking im about to bust some fucking heads.... thank god for the reality check of mr 6' 2', 230lb+ bouncer dude standing in front...... 

i go back in. drink. laugh and i head outside for another smoke. 

W T F. another guys straight up dogging me (yes, i said dogging, yes im old. screw you). 

fuck it. if i get arrested tonight, so be it.  i center my attention on the tallest/biggest guy in the group. ALWAYS take on the biggest guy of the group. the rest of his friends wont be expecting that. i stare at the guy, hes about 5' 10", skinny though.... i stare at him. follow him from the right side of me to the left...... oh shit.... 

OH SHIT.... OH SHIT!!!!!!!

apparently theres a gay bar next door to the bloodhound. 

its friday night. 

asian night.

i literally laugh out loud and run back inside.

i may be a moron, but daddys still got it!!!
author: Euge L.

description: I used to come here when this place was Cassady's. The upgrade is nice without being stuffy, and I'm glad to see that the pool table is still there. The bartenders are friendly, the drinks are good, and it's laid-back enough that people feel comfortable bringing their laptops in to work early in the evening (if you're into that). The place also gets some nice natural sunlight around that time, so it doesn't feel like you're diving into a dark drinking hole.
author: stephanie l.

description: Ooo! Loved it! Yummy drinks (I think I had 2 Palomas) and I liked that I could sit. I like to sit & drink bc I'm just that lazy.
author: Shal J.

description: I really love what they did with the space. Went on a Saturday night. It was packed with an attractive crowd. The bartenders were attentive and busy. The cocktail selection was good.  It was a great place to start the evening out.
author: Jennifer S.

description: amazing place with a friendly staff.  Darin and Dillon always make my visits the best!  I love the decor and the beers on tap.  Can 't say enough great things about them.
author: Reg H.

description: The random hunting lodge motif is fun.  Friday crowd was a mix of Fidi, Mission and SOMA folks.  Standouts about Bloodhound: tons of seating for big groups, good beers on tap, hip vibe and a pool table.  $9 cocktails to enjoy in rustic cabin stylez.
author: Sid D.

description:
*happy hour fun in the city*

this place felt cozy after a few drinks and bloodhound is a pretty lively watering hole after 4pm. darin, our bartender, took care of us and remembered to place two limes on my chopin and tonics. kudos. 

awesome selection of liquor, beer and wine. they even sell chicharones. i'd come back here again. plus i love to glance at their ceiling! ;o)
author: Mika D.

description:
Fantastic addition to the hood.Great bar, great bar tenders, great cocktails - unfortunately the same old Cassidy's a-holes hanging round the pool table.
A little work on the bathrooms wouldn't go amiss. But all-in-all I reckon the DD boys have done it again. Looking forward to daytime opening at the weekends.
author: tee b.

description: Solid local bar - good drinks, rustic ambiance and a pool table!
author: Ms. P.

description: I agree with the other reviews. This place is pretty cool. I like the painted birds on the ceiling and the decor. Sort of rustic and vintage with an edge. We came on a Wednesday night and it was relatively busy, but there was plenty of standing room at the bar, no tables left. They have a pool table in the back. Everyone seems pretty chill and they have an interesting drink list, including bloodhounds!
author: Natalie S.

description: I hate to say it but it's the old Irish bar, gutted, with rustic wood on the walls and antlers.  Like Big Foot Lodge minus the coziness.
author: Melanie C.

description: This place took over my favorite dive bar, Cassidy's, and for that I cannot give it a full 4 stars. That being said, it's a good spot to chill and chat with friends. It has an entertaining Big Buck Hunter arcade in the back. Normal beer selection with a few different varieties. The first bar I've had Moose Drool Brown Ale and it keeps me coming back for more.
author: Kim L.

description: Comfortable, chill bar, pool table, decent parking and moderate bar prices. Oh, and clean bathrooms - always a plus!
author: Adrienne C.

description: Decent enough boozer. Normally plenty of space and cool bar staff. Pool table and that deer hunting game. Ceiling is decorated with lots of painted birds, so not good if you're ornithophobic. Never really like the beer in the jar thing, prefer glasses but alcoholics will drink from anything.
author: Lager K.

description: Sometimes when embarrassing things happen to me in a bar, I never return, and trust me, I've done some embarrassing things. But Bloodhound is helping me transcend the shame.  Sure, I spent an hour hitting on the only cute guy in the whole bar, while unbeknownst to me, his girlfriend was RIGHT THERE next to him the whole time, but I'm cool with that.  And sure, I spilled my beer right after last call in front of said guy, and begged for a new one, but that's cool too.  I'm over it.  Because this place had seating, good music, good drinks, and an awesome female bartender who took mercy on me and gave me a half pint of beer to make up for the spilled stuff.  I'll go back with my head held high.
author: Kim S.

description:
overly formulaic, yet solid.

the build-out of this place with the wood, taxidermy, decor, etc. is well-executed, but too well executed IMO, if that makes any sense.  i just feel like this place is trying too hard to be hipster-ish.  its kinda like the California Adventures equivalent of a whiskey bar.  like they serve beer in jars?  creative yes, but c'mon.  beer in a jar??  not cool.  

but don't get me wrong, there's a lot of stuff going for bloodhound.  there is plenty of space to sit, and the bar is very long.  drinks are very reasonably priced, I had a bourbon old fashioned (they used george dickel, a plus) for only $7.  the crowd was a decent mix (I was here on a Wednesday) and the lone bartender was very friendly and knowledgeable when I asked him about certain whiskies.  

i don't think that i'll be back anytime soon, but I'll be back eventually to see how this place evolves.
author: Scott K.

description: Sometimes in SF you find bartenders or waitstaff that just think they are the best thing in the world. Usually this lake of humility means they are really far from such. I had this experience at Bloodhound on a Sunday night. We were with two really good friends and we all wanted bourbon drinks. We decided on Bloodhound. My partner decided on a special bourbon drink. She got it back to the table and accidentally spilled it everywhere. I needed to get a rag and I asked if we could get another drink made (I would have tipped him generously, as we did the first round).  He said, "that pain in the ass drink she wanted? Looks like the one she has is still half full." I did want to jump over the bar and punch him but I didn't. I got my rag and walked away. If the bar would have been full I would have never asked. It was empty and he was just an asshole. Everyone I was with are in the industry. They are all waiters and bartenders so we all decided to never, ever go back to Bloodhound. Honestly if you like a Marina crowd with bartenders who think they are more than they are than this is your place. Oh and if you are queer this is probably also not your place.
author: Candace C.

description: I'm a big fan of Bloodhound. The location is easy to find. Bar is chill. Good place to meet up with friends, watch a game and just relax. Owners are really hands on and terrific people. Good mellow crowd. Would highly recommend to anyone.
author: Anthony H.

description:
I celebrated the old birthday here recently, and it was a great time.

Here's a familiar trade-off. You go to a bar where you feel comfortable, but the only drink the bartender knows how to serve well is a pint of beer. Or you go to a place that has got quality bartenders, but then you're hemorrhaging cash and dealing with a pretentious clientele.

Bloodhound gives you the best of both worlds. Dylan, the bartender and co-owner, mixes up some great drinks, but they don't cost you an arm and a leg, and no one expects you to be dressed to the nines to get past the door. The hunting lodge aesthetic seems to say, "If you're just a fella tryin' to do a thing, then yeah, come on in, brochacho." It's a dive bar that's not at all a dive bar.

One thing to be aware of: when I was here last Saturday, I saw multiple waves of different sorts of people come in over the course of the evening. The character of the clientele here has not yet been irrevocably defined, and I'm hopeful that the patrons on the whole remain unpretentious and laid back as time goes on. So if you're not a douchebag, please come on by -- let's not lose yet another cool, relaxed place to the d-bag element.
author: Eugene P.

description: The mason jars are cute.  The space is big but a little too narrow and too long.  The decor is interesting.  BUT THE PLACE SMELLS!
author: Jen C.

description: Good beer. Good service. Weird decore. Weird music. That works for me!!
author: Casi C.

description: Unfortunately I won't be living just steps away from this cool bar anymore.  I love the decor going all the way with the "be bery bery quiet, I'm huntin wabbits," theme of all wood and more wood, as well as antlers.  The beer selection doesn't fail, but you may fail from drinking enough of it while hunting for deer, antelopes, and other wild thangs on the arcade or from pool.  Very cool, chill spot to have drinks.
author: Linda P.

description: Love this place. Not fancy, not shady, with a hunting man's decor to boot, plus the right mix of good folks. Drinks in mason jars? Awesome. Where else in SF can you get drunk with buddies and shoot at deers (arcade machine in the back).
author: Wilfred C.

description: Cocktails in mason jars...  I love this place so much - great vibe, great decor, great crowd.
author: David A.

description:
As promised, Bloodhound was a blast.  I love the decor, they did a great job.  It was absolutely packed over opening weekend and I'm really looking forward to stopping by on a quieter evening for some pool and casual drinks.  Looks to be a good happy hour addition for a group with commuters since parking is usually a breeze in the area at that time of day.
It's hard to get a read on the crowd just yet (really really young kids, hostel crowds, Marina spillover and Double Dutch regulars all mixed together when I was there), but it seems like a good group.  They have lots of beers too, not just your run of the mill PBR and Anchor Steam, but their official cocktail menu left a little something to be desired according to my palate.
I spent way too long trying to decide if the birds on the ceiling were stenciled or wallpapered before I noticed they were the exact same layout on every panel.  Like anyone else in the world would care.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I love this bar. I've hosted a few work happy hours here, and they have always been a big success. The executives like it because it's clean, there's room to sit, and lots of big windows. The workers like it because it isn't pretentious, and they've got a pool table and Buck Hunter. Overall, I think this is a great bar, with friendly bartenders, and I like to go here as much as possible.
author: Julie B.

description:
good (not great) beer selection.
above average liquor selection.
retained one of the two pool tables (it used to be "Cassidy's")
mason jars for serving is a nice touch.
comfortable seating, 15 or so spots at the bar.

two doors to access smoking.
author: bill f.

description:
My days in SF are coming to an end.  I'm taking the plunge and finally moving to NYC.  These past few weeks have been a whirlwind of going out every night in order to hit as many of my bookmarks as possible.  I'm a little tired to say the least.
Bloodhound has been bookmarked since they opened, and I finally made my way in not once, but twice in the past week.  I've been missing out.  This is my bar.
My first visit was Saturday around 6:30.  The bar was pretty empty, spattered with some regulars and their pooches (love that).  I had one of their bourbon cocktails (normally $9, $1 off at happy hour).  The owners themselves were behind the bar.  Very friendly and engaging.  Love the painted birds on the ceiling, the deer antlers, pool tables, beer served in Mason jars.  Definitely won over.
My second visit was Thursday around 6:30.  Completely different atmosphere.  Busy, nowhere to sit, took forever to get drinks, despite 4 guys behind the bar.  But I still liked it.  I had the Sazerac and the Bloodhound (Hangar 1 with fresh grapefruit).  We brought in grub from Brainwash, which they were cool with, and they played Eminem at one point in the evening (that is a plus in my book).
author: Sarah M.

description:
lots of wood. lots of antlers. lots of booze.

i like this place a lot, they got a pool table, plenty of space, and seating. i even left my jacket there, and the next day when i returned for it the bartender fished it out of the lost and found for me.
author: Ameer N.

description: Beer out of mason jars.  Well executed cocktails.  A nice open seating area with a pool table and Buckhunter in the back.  The beer is cold, decor is simple (lots of dark wood), and the bartenders are friendly and cater to the finer palate.
author: Mike T.

description: Great beer selection that they serve in mason jars and big buck hunter. This place is one of my favorite bars in the city.  It's never super crowded (yet) and is a dive bar that is still pretty clean.  Definitely worth checking out!
author: Jessica J.

description: I met some friends at Bloodhound after work on a wednesday, and I was pleasantly surprised by how much I truly enjoyed every aspect of this bar. Its fun, laid back (I can't stand pretentious bars) and the best part.....Big Buck Hunter! Its literally the most entertaining video game ever. I will be back. Soon.
author: erin s.

description: Cool enough, but I prefer to down my Old Speckled Hen in a pint glass and not a gimmicky Mason jar.
author: Maximillian M.

description: This place rocks. I'm a local, so it's my watering hole. The folks who work there are cool to chat with. The ONLY issue I have with this place is the noise when it's super-crowded. Other than that, pool is good. Duck hunt is ok. A fun time on a weeknight!
author: Dave T.

description: This place gives me a feeling like I'm on a ski trip, yet only in SOMA. I love the wood painted ceiling with the wood decor and the antlerchandelier. It has such a woodsy rustic feel even though it's nowhere near the woods. I love the open space, it's good for happy hour and has a lively but not overcrowded feeling. I've often gotten a seat if needed and usually don't have to wait tooo long to get a drink. They have a great beer selection - bottled and tap, as well as the wide selection of cocktails. I especially love that the beer comes in jar- like glasses, very laid back. This is definitly a fun place during the week. I can't speak for the weekend as it's usually an after work spot for me.
author: Lindsay A.

description: Great happy hour, full of friendly, interesting people...  And they have a small but tasty selection of Belgian beers, always worth an extra few stars in my book!
author: Mason G.

description: I love this bar! It's a mixed crowd with a cozy hip decor and a rugged edge that's all very unpretentious. Just enough people to keep up the energy level but no so annoyingly crowded that you fear taking a nose dive into your cocktail when you go in for a sip. Smart move on the long bar tables so you can set your drink down and lean on to take some weight off of the stilettos. Best of all, strong drinks.
author: Thu S.

description: There is something sexy and brooding about this place.  Is it the relaxed yet posh atmosphere?  Perhaps it's the country modern style of wood paneling and antler chandeliers?  Perhaps it's a little bit of both.  It was a really pleasant place to hang out with friends.  Bloodhound is pretty spacious for a bar although I can see it getting packed over the weekends.  The drinks were good and bartenders were cute and helpful.  I had one of the specialty cocktails - Peach -something or other.  It was a perfect sweet girly drink with plenty of alcohol.  I came here with a few friends on a Wednesday night and I would definitely come back.  I really like that the music was not very loud, so we could actually have a conversation without shouting.  The music selection was also good  - something jazzy and easy to enjoy.
author: Lidiya B.

description: I really like this bar. Old Speckled Hen on tap, a very good bartender, great scenery, lots of space and plenty of seating. The drinks aren't overpriced and the place is very clean. I'll be back fo sho.
author: Corey V.

description:
i very much like this place!!  The drinks are as different and hearty as their decor.  I have found the staff all pretty helpful and friendly as well.  I believe it was some orange haired gentleman that made me a Dr. Hemmingway drink.  It was so good I had 2!!  It was so good I came back a week later with my sister... alas, the ginger mixologist was the only one who possesed the great secret of my favorite drink.  There were orange bitter, gin, and idunno... angel kisses in it or something!!
I did try another beverage from their special menu .. the pegu... it was veryyy delicious as well.  
The crowds were so different from both nights I hope I am giving a fair review.  The saturday night crowd was packed and a bit yuppyish... but great music and still a great vibe!!
The Thursday crowd was a lot more chill, laid back... a lot more flannel then necessary... i liked it!!  However, the music was just not the same.  I think I prefer the weekend bloodhound.  The bartenders were a lot more interesting, the drinks were better, the music was better.. just bring your own friends.  
Oh and watch your purse!  Some chick got her purse stolen while we were there.
Overall, I enjoyed this place and I will definitely come back!
author: blair k.

description: Completely agree with Jenny W - prowl-ability factor is high here for happy hour, and has no skeezy vibe about it.  It's just a fun bar with a rugged manly vibe, but totally welcoming to us gals.  Totally diverse crowd; ambiance is casual enough to almost want to call it a dive-bar, but it is so far from a dive... it's just right!  Bartenders are great.  Love that beer comes in mason jars.  However, I have this compelling need to order a Jack and something or another every time I am here.  Friday night they had a sidewalk kitchen serving up flatbread pizzas.  A Sunday afternoon brought fantastic pulled pork bbq sammies.  Next time if I have that second Jack and something or another I might just take on the Buck Hunter video game!
author: Danielle R.

description: I think this is my new favorite spot, I wish it was closer to where I lived .Super awesome decor, really friendly bartenders,great jukebox, great drinks .Only negative is they are sorta on the pricey side but I don't mind it much
author: Lauren V.

description:
this place can get crowded. 

for the number of people, the bartenders do a good job making sure you have a drink. 

the crowd is usually diverse and i am a fan of their mason jar glasses.
