the downside is that is predominately a standing bar. coaches and seats seem to have a waiting line, with everyone clamoring for the next available seat.
author: Mauri L.

description:
I got to check out this new bar last night because my friend knows the owners and I really like it!  It is decorated kind of like a log cabin/ski lodge, but in a way that manages not to be cheesy or dive-y.  To the contrary, the ambiance in this place is great...relaxed enough but still nice.

I can't say what the crowd will be like because it hasn't technically opened yet to the public, but the owners seem really nice and the atmosphere is on point.  So check it out!!!
author: Jessi C.

description: Amazing cocktails.  Dog friendly.  My favorite bar in San Francisco.
author: Jill B.

description: You know what? I really like this place. It's not too divey, not too yuppie, and not too hipster. The unusual decór is fabulous too. The bartenders are nice too (gasp).
author: Caitanya M.

description:
we likey likey.
super cute and cozy hunting theme. cool birdies on the ceiling..  and the big buck hunter shooting game in the back is pimp.
bartender poured stiff and his ipod playlist was on point. 
why not?
author: Caroline S.

description: Bloodhound is great.  Mason jars, antlers, big windows.  The bartender was SUPER happy (too happy?) but the best part is they have that hunting game that I can't get enough of. Well done.  I just wish you weren't in the sticks.
author: Mia A.

description: I think I will love this bar once it's hipness dies down a bit. It's just too packed right now. Shoot, maybe i'm just too damn old for this place.
author: Monika M.

description: Fun, easy going bar with a good selection of beers and awesome beer glasses to match. Best part was you could order Thai food two doors down and chow down at the bar. Gotta love it.
author: Mamie C.

description: Bloodhound's centrality and open layout make for an excellent meeting place between friends new and old. The pool table, high tables, and long bar contribute to the standard bar features, but the capable mixology being conducted by its hosts will surprise you. Get the Moscow Mule-inspired Recoil -- truly refreshing!
author: Beau H.

description: I thought I would be turned off by the "woodsy" motif but Bloodhound was much better than I imagined.  A good sized space, hunter-esque ambiance but not overwhelmingly so, and a bar / non-wine bar with decently priced glasses of decent wine.  Crazy talk.
author: Melinda C.

description:
in an area where there isn't much choice, this shines like a proverbial star.
great theme and decor styling
drinking draft beer out of a jam jar has never been more fun
a winner.
author: david s.

description:
I went here for a happy hour last Friday and I was bummed I forgot my chaps, 10-gallon hat, and six-shooters.

This bar has a strange modern-western theme with beers served in mason jars, bartenders in western shirts and of course "Deer Hunter" in the back. Yet somehow this all works. I was digging the indy tunes they had playing (not sure if it was a juke box or what). 

The crowd was your typical after work crowd, but the whole feel of this place was very causual, unpretentious, with friendly bartenders. If I lived in the area I would probably make this bar my hangout.
author: Triton H.

description: Pretty sweet bar, but not so sweet location. For me it was definitely a destination spot, but was well worth it. The selection of liquor is awesome as is their beer. Old Speckled Hen on tap was enough to make me happy along with the chiccarones that were available at the time. Great decor, just wish it was a little closer...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
this bar is great.  good drinks, good service, good prices, and has a cool feel to it.  Daren and Dillon are all pro bartenders.

I like going here after work, more than going out late night, and is a great spot to play some pool or buckhunter.

same people who own double dutch in the mission
author: Nick H.

description: For a Tuesday night, excellent service, good crowd, tasty drafts, slighty scary but well mannered bartender. Sound system needs an upgrade
author: Mark M.

description: Thank goodness for another spot in the neighborhood where I can go and just get a simple beer after work. A big improvement over the previous tenant. The owner was friendly - especially after I mentioned that I walk by the bar almost everyday getting to and from work/home. Loved the wood behind the bar, the birds and the simple feel.
author: B S.

description: The place serves a very good selection of beers, draft and in bottle and a can as well.  The mixed drinks served are deep and good.  Bathrooms are clean, so if you looking for a tagged out piss hole, please find your "dive".  Bloodhound serves a well made booze in a decent atmosphere with a couple of flat panel TV's (yes sports), a pool table, buck hunter and a nice jukebox not limited to b.s. top 40, rap crap, oldies, or tex mex.  If you are a hyper critical hipster, don't come here, open your own sh!t box.
author: Mickey D.

description: This is a great bar,  Mike has done it well in an inviting Hunting lodge theme,  mason jars for beer, Buck hunter, and pool tables.  It reminds me of back home in Virginia.
author: Doug D.

description: I love this place I went there last night and had a few of the buttered rum drinks. I love the vibe of the place and the bartender was amazing he worked his ass off and got us drinks really fast.
author: Alexandra R.

description: I came here last night for the first time, and I'm hooked. The lodge decor makes it feel warm and inviting, and the patrons are friendly and eager to start conversation. The drinks were pricey, but delicious and expertly mixed. The bartender is a big bear of a man, but very friendly. I have read from past reviews that this place can get real "Marina douchbag" on the weekends, which is why I'll stick to weekdays. For once, there is a great bar in SOMA that is unassuming, inviting and has no specific scene. I will be back for sure!
author: Maurice R.

description: So good I want to give it 1 star so people don't find out about it, but I just can't do that.  Great drinks and beer selection served in mason jars.  They have big buck hunter and pool to keep you entertained along with great music.  The place looks like a hipster hunting lodge, but it somehow works.  Good, diverse crowd to watch and interact with.
author: Ian M.

description: Whiskey sour with a black cherry in a good sized Old Fashioned glass for under $9 is the classiest deal south of market. Attractive bartenders, lodge meets art gallery decor, and lots of seating is all I want in a bar.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and finally had a chance to check out the newbie this past weekend. This is a cool-looking bar with friendly owners (extrapolated from speaking with the one behind the bar) which I will no doubt frequent on many occasions in the future. However, I will not  be ordering many mixed drinks as the vodka and seven I ordered was surprisingly light on the vodka. Maybe it's because I make mine at home at about an 80-20 split. 

UPDATE: They started opening up a little earlier a few days a week which I like bc I have a window from 4:30-5:30 almost every day during the week when I can grab a drink before heading home.

The bar gets a bit too crowded and loud for my tastes on later on weekend evenings, but I'm 38 and married with a kid.

UPDATE 2: The owners seem to be really cool guys. One of them even turned one of the tvs to the Big East Semi-Final game when I asked...when the Warriors were on! This bar is definitely a welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Christopher S.

description: vast choice of craft beers and billiards in the back, nice hangout spot
author: Alex W.

description: Okay, granted I first came here in a Emmy's Spaghetti Shack-induced haze of meatballs and Sapporo, but I do still recall the huge deer antler chandelier and why I will never again scarf down the entire pepper dunked in Bloodhound's tasty Bloody Mary. (My eyes are tearing just reliving the moment.) The Big Buck Hunter arcade machine in the corner is an especially nice touch, mostly because I would never expect one to exist (or last) in a bar in San Francisco. I like this place because it's got a lot of open floor space, which means never having to decide between offering my crotch or ass Tyler Durden-style to whomever I'm trying to squeeze by.
author: Raffy E.

description: Awesome aesthetic--antlers on the wall and bourbon in mason jars and big buck hunter.  Close to Civic Center Bart.  Seemed like good people, although there was a little bit of a businessperson afterhappyhour vibe to it--more vertical striped button-downs than I expected.  But it takes all sorts, right?  And how often do you get to kick it under some deer trophies?
author: george t.

description: delicious drinks in a cute bar, just wish the area wasn't so sketchy
author: Cece W.

description: Went to the bloodhound when I was staying at Good Hotel around the corner.  I'm so glad I found this place!  They have a great selection of beer (try Back in Black from 21st Amendment!) at decent prices.  The crowd was chill and the music was diverse in genre and age--very enjoyable selection.   When I went on Sunday, the woman's bathroom was kinda gross--the toilet had overflowed and the floor was wet but it wasn't unbearable.  The bartender, Courtney, made up for it by helping my friend and I pick new beer to sample based on what we knew we liked.  We actually ended up going back the next night when we were meeting up with a Friend who lives in San Fran--I now have a favorite bar in the city :)
author: Talia W.

description: Very cool bar. Pleanty of bar, table, and lounge seating. Excellent selection of spirits, draft and bottle beers, as well as specialty cocktails. You can get a can of olympia for dirt cheap, or a glass of delerium tremens belgium from the tap. I will continue to come back.
author: Chris T.

description: Great chill bar to grab a tasty draft, complete with mason jar. Well definitely return!
author: Rich S.

description: Beer, ball games and dogs. Friendly people and playful hounds. SF classic.
author: Timothy S.

description: Tasty, weak cocktails.  Cute Mason jars.  Jackass bartender, at least on Sunday.  Kind of felt like I was in the Marina.  I won't be back.
author: C. M.

description: ehhh...I'm not sure if I'm with the polished hunting lodge thing...a little bland.  And it's not very intimate or rowdy. There's a great bartender, blond with a cool little pink streak; totally sweet and helpful.
author: Jake H.

description:
i am excited to have found a cool new bar - i went to bloodhound for a birthday happy hour on friday, and really liked it.  crowd was fun, casual.  bartenders were super friendly, and the bar menu had great drinks.  i was partial to the bloodhound #1.  music was great too - i liked almost every song.  they do have a pool table if thats your thing.  a decent amount of seating at the bar and tables.  
great spot - can't wait to go back!
author: Carolyn B.

description: original idea... hunting lodge atmospher/decore and NO DJ... great place to hang out and chat with friends. friendly staff and i loved that there were friendly dogs in there hanging out too (big plus for me).
author: Elaine Y.

description: Nice vibe, good services, prices and drinks seemed right on.  No idea how I missed it for a year of working just around the corner.
author: James B.

description: Love this place - went for the first time last weekend. Very cool interior, cool people & cool music. Will be going back!
author: Jo D.

description: This place is hilariously cool.  Just when I thought the SOMA bar scene was getting a little stale these guys opened up with there "trapper john meets San Francisco" thing.  I know it sounds strange but you gotta check this place out.  Its designed like an old hunting cabin in there and they regularly BBQ all kinds of tasty meats and give it away.  The bartenders could not be nicer people and honestly the patrons too.  Its really a fun place!
author: Cameron Y.

description: three cheers for bloodhound, and co-owner dylan who is super helpful and friendly. Thanks for indulging me and my friend with all our drunken questions about your bar :) I will be back many times when in the neighborhood!
author: Caddy M.

description: Bloodhound is fairly new and used to be where Cassady's lived. My friend who lives in that area always went to Cassady's and loved it. Bloodhound is no different. Super-friendly bartender! Yummy selection of beer! Only drawback for me is lack of table-seating. It's all stools and high tables or sitting at the bar. And that's killer on my back.
author: Elizabeth Z.

description: I can't help but love this bar.  The staff was super fun, and the remodel they did is quite nice.  Just be careful!  The Hunting video game is very addicting ;)
author: Sean M.

description: so this place is pretty awesome. came here a few times with a friend of mine. the bartenders totally know what they are talkin about. Our bartender Christina was awesome and really freakin pretty. She was very personable and suggested drinks that were super tasty. cool ambiance , cool bartenders, tasty drinks...what else is there to say?
author: Angelyne T.

description: I really like this new bar! I was surprised Cassidy's closed, but Bloodhound is a great replacement. The managers/owners are awesome and friendly, the decor is charming and there's a good selection of libations including my all time favorite beer, Le Chouffe.
author: Colleen B.

description: 4 stars for the service and an extra star for the mason jars. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for an after work get together spot - laid back and relaxing vibe.
author: Austin C.

description:
bloodhound is my go-to bar near where i live. it's a bit hipster, and gets real crowded on friday/saturday nights, but the drinks are solid, and the place is just plain cool. 

i love greyhounds, they make a good one.

and they serve drinks in jam jars.

and they have birds painted on the ceiling.
author: grace l.

description: I really only spent a small amount of time there as we were just stopping by on our way to The Trannyshack event across the street. But, i will say that I was very happy with the atmosphere, the cozy seating, it was not too crowded either.  the bartender was a man's man and very friendly and helpful.  He turned me on to a new Belgian beer "La Choux" which I absolutely loved.  Great place with a lot of class! Loved it! Great Music as well! Love a place where I can hear some Motorhead! Can't wait to go back and spend more time and $ there!!
author: Joseph B.

description: read about this place in gq~when i read about spots like this in the city i always rip the article & bookmark the hot spot on here~similar spot/vibe to rickhouse/bourbon & branch as in specialty drinks/ingredients wit a lil magic show~meaning the way they prepare/make the drinks....very loungy wit the jukebox rockin...i was stuck on the recoil drink 3 times...if your picky about value/presentation~...they serve these drinks in mini jars~the drinks are potent~really wanted to try the old speckled hen....but didnt wana mix =x....ill be back tho
author: elmer d.

description: A well needed upgrade from the previous establishment at this location. Great mix of people hang out here and you could meet anybody from a Hells Angel to an Irish tourist. Only down side is that they insist on serving pints out of jars! I vowed to not return because of this but changed my since it is one of the few places I have been able to find that has Scrimshaw Pilsner on tap. It's a bit strange because they have a ton of pint glasses lined up but you have to argue with the bartender to be served from one...LOL.
author: David H.

description: I really like Bloodhound.  I really like the hunting game that they have their.  I really like the bacon infused bourbon.  I really like the fact that they have very inexpensive happy hour Olympias.  I really like the bartenders that work/own the place.  I really like the different food trucks that are parked out front almost everyday and the different food offerings they all have.  These guys did it right.  Been there numerous times and have a good time always.
author: Anthony Y.

description: Hands down best bar in SOMA. Unfortunately you sometimes have to deal with pre madonna drunk girls who think eating bar olives and mouthing off to the bartender is ok.
author: Robert P.

description: buck-buck-BUCKHUNTER!  Finally SF catches on.
author: Beer L.

description: this place is a really awesome chill bar.  good beer selection, great cocktails too.  they sell those amazing 4505 chicharons. friendly bartenders.  what more can i say, this bar is just dope.
author: vlad k.

description: Great place.  Great atmosphere.  Good prices. Had a blast all three visits!!
author: Ellen R.

description: Atmosphere is chill in here.(except I forgot my rifle)  I love shooting a game of pool after a long day at work. Place is chill and I don't feel awkward in my overalls
author: Joely L.

description: sundays are a day for many things. going to church, visiting family, or heading down to bloodhound to have a delicious bloody mary, greyhound or pimms cup with bartender ryan.  bloodhound for sunday football is a magical thing.  it can cure hangovers, really, it can! things i love about bloodhound: they have buckhunter (although i swear the orange gun is janky), on sundays they have cats head bbq serving up delicious sliders, wings and jalepeno poppers, and sometimes they play "i got a feeling" by the black eyed peas ... but in spanglish.  okay, the last part is a lie, but the other two reasons should be more than enough to mozy down there for a little hair of the dog. never mind that the drinks may taste salty, that's just from my tears spilled from watching the raiders lose ... again.
author: Veronica Y.

description: What makes Bloodhound stand out the most is that it is a decent bar located in the vast, (for the most part) empty wasteland of SOMA. If this bar was located on Polk among dozens of other bars just like it, it wouldn't be nearly as cool. So props to the owner for abiding by real estate rule #1: location, location, location. I've hit up Bloodhound for happy hour with co-workers and to kill some time before a show. They have a giant selection and boast some unique beers such as the Moose Drool Brown Ale. Even when it's busy the bartenders take the time to talk to you, and I was able to sample a few beers before making my selection. Beers are served in old fashioned mason jars, which adds a kitschy little touch to the overall experience. The decor reminds me of a modern log cabin home with some indie art thrown in. Bloodhound is a good place to bring a big group since the majority of the space is open. There is a fairly large lounge near the front window you can gather a crowd around, or you can pull a bunch of stools up around the long wood slab tables. There's a pool table in the back, and I have seen many friendly games played out there (nothing like the stick cracking debauchery at Delirium). Every time I've been to Bloodhound, it has been immaculate. I actually think it will have more character and be more inviting a few years down the road when it gets grimed up. For the most part, the people that frequent Bloodhound are young professionals with a few 'seasoned' professionals thrown in for good stories. I've seen people in there working on their laptops as well, but that's always earlier in the night before things get too messy. I like Bloodhound because it is close to my office and a good stop before heading over to a show in the area, but I wouldn't be trying to go all the way down to SOMA on a weekend just to go to Bloodhound.
author: Breanna L.

description: this place is ok. i liked cassidy's a little better though because it attracted a lot less douchebags. and are the mason jars pint sized? i thought i kinda got ripped off on my beer ...
author: James J.

description: My new favorite local bar!  I love that they serve beer in mason jars.  The drinks are reasonably priced and its easy to hang out here - especially since they allow outside food and dogs in the place!
author: stephanie w.

description: didn't stay long cause it was kind of boring.  Best if you bring good company
author: Laura C.

description: new favorite bar. im glad this region of SoMa, which i primarily visit for the cat club on thursday nights (80s) and for random stuff like california carpets, has such a great addition to the mix.  awesome beer selection. i basically havent heard of any of them and they are all delicious plus served in different cool classes such as a jam jar.  i want to try every one of the beers.  this place has a good vibe of casual but not dive-y or dingy, good mix of people - not too hipster/not too marina, relatively few d-bags, and good ambient music.  i hope it will be successful and will bring to the neighborhood some more bars like it!
author: Cathy L.

description: On my most recent trip to San Francisco my friends and I decided to go to some of their favorite bars. We went to the bloodhound late one evening after running out of options in the Russian hill area and wanting to go to a place nearer to home. When we got there it was crowded but since it was late we found a table not too long after arriving. I spent most of the evening drinking mateveza so I was wide awake but didn't want to drink any more filling beers. I loked at the signature cocktail menu and fell on love. In Philadelphia we have loads of options for good beer and what I have been gathering is that sf is a great place for artisan cocktails. I tried a few different ones on the menu but settled on the recoil. It was sharp and a bit fizzy with a good bit of sour. The bartenders were friendly and accomodating. I really enjoyed myself there. The next time i'm in SFO ill be visiting the Bloodhound
author: Darreck R.

description: love this place i work up the street and i always try to make it in for a drink whenever im close by. i call it an "upgraded dive" because its a totally chill vibe for the neighborhood and it can go both ways, if you want a can beer for a few bucks done! if you want a great cocktail with a high end spirit done!done!double done. plus they have plenty of seating a pool table AND buckhunterrrrrrrrrrrr
author: David R.

description: was only here briefly, but big fan.  very nice bartender, great feel to the space (reminded me of bar tartine), overall just the right attitude
author: James R.

description: Night time drinking is fine but careful if you go there to catch football on Sunday morning. Some guy told me few weeks ago it was kind of Seahawks place. Was he right, there is a guy there who tells the bartender what to put on the TV and if your game happens at the same time as a seahawks game, good luck catching your game.
author: sid c.

description: This is becoming one of my regulars if for no other reason than the never ending juke box.  Great beer selection, not too pricey, and I swear the pool table is rigged in my favor.
author: Margaret S.

description: nice, clean place with a nice, clean crowd. we got here at the end of the night (1am-ish) so there weren't too many people there (it was also a large space). we played a round of pool in the back 'til closing time. the bouncer was pretty nice about not having us leave right away.
author: Kan L.

description: cool, spacious bar. $9 cocktails, $5 draught beer.  clean. easy parking.
author: Caitlin G.
